title: kiss_x_sis
body:
Kiss x Sis (キスシス) is a manga series by [[Ditama bow]], it was adapted for OVA and anime TV series. It follows the life of [[Suminoe Keita]] as he tries to balance studying with his stepsisters' sexual advances.

h4.Characters

    * [[Suminoe Keita]] (protagonist)
    * [[Suminoe Ako]] (Keita's stepsister, the elder twin sister)
    * [[Suminoe Riko]] (Keita's stepsister, the younger twin sister)
    * [[Mikuni Miharu]]
    * [[Kiryuu Mikazuki]]
    * [[Kiryuu Yuuzuki]]

title: leichter_panzerspahwagen
body:
The [b]Leichter Panzerspähwagen[/b] (German: "light armoured reconnaissance vehicle") was a series of light four-wheel drive [[armored vehicle|armoured]] [[car]]s produced by [[Nazi]] Germany from 1935 to 1944. The series included [b]Sd.Kfz.221[/b], [b][[sdkfz 222|Sd.Kfz.222]][/b], [b]Sd.Kfz.223[/b] and unarmed [b]Sd.Kfz.260/261[/b].

h4. External links

title: nun_bora_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd costume of [[Nijisanji KR]]'s [[Nun Bora]], released on Valentine's Day 2021, as seen in post #4364065. It is arguably her most recognizable appearance, as it was used as her primary outfit after it was unveiled.

This outfit is a [[school uniform]] with a [[purple cardigan]] over a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt]] [[shirt tucked in|tucked into]] a [[blue skirt]], with [[black thighhighs]] and a [[pink bowtie]].

In this outfit she usually wears her hair [[short hair|short]] with a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] and [[hairband]]. This look also revealed that she has [[medium breasts]] under the thick winterwear of her original outfit.

title: asahara_shoukou
body: Real name Matsumoto Chizuo, Asahara was the founder and head guru of the cult [[AUM Shinrikyo]]. He was found responsible for causing the 1995 Tokyo subway sarin attack, among numerous other terrorist attacks in the early to mid-1990s, and was executed as a result.

title: aum_shinrikyo
body:
Real life religious cult and terrorist organization. After causing numerous terrorist attacks, most notably the 1995 subway sarin attack in Tokyo, the group was effectively disbanded, with the head guru responsible for the attack, [[Asahara Shoukou]], arrested and later executed.

The remaining holdovers of AUM has since rebranded themselves as Aleph, with another group known as Hikari no Wa (ひかりの輪) sprintering from it.

title: maryland_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Maryland[/i] (BB-46). 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance
In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|well endowed]] yet petite body, much like her sister [i]Colorado[/i]. She wears a yardarm [[headgear]], a two-tone [[grey dress]] with blue accents and a [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] that superficially appears [[strapless dress|strapless]], a [[blue necktie]] with her hull number (46) on it, [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] held by [[garter straps]], a grey [[capelet]], and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] is the same as that of her sister's, with all four of her historic 406 mm twin gun mounts, two of her 127 mm open pedestal mounts, a [[smokestack]], and her real-life cage mast with a range clock. Her [[Maryland Kai (Kancolle)|first remodel]] swaps her range clock for an SK [[radar]] mounted atop the mast.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Maryland[/i] was moored inboard of the [i]Oklahoma[/i] at Pearl Harbor on the day of the attack and largely escaped damage while Oklahoma capsized from the bomb and torpedo damage sustained. Several of Oklahoma's sailors assisted Maryland's crew in the attack while Maryland's crew assisted in rescue efforts aboard Oklahoma.

She was among the first battleships from the attack to reenter active service, sortieing with the other available units during the [[battle of Midway]] as a standby force.

She participated in shore bombardment duties in the battles of Tarawa and Saipan before seeing action in the battle of Leyte Gulf against "Nishimura's fleet.":/pools/9549 Later on, she sustained kamikaze damage on the same day as [[Operation Ten-Gou|Operation Ten-go]] (which also explains her being the reward for Spring 2022 E-5, which is based off [i]Ten-Go[/i]), which put her out of action for the rest of the conflict. She was decommissioned in 1947 and scrapped 12 years later.

h4. [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleships
* [[Colorado (Kancolle)]] (BB-45)
* [b]Maryland [/b] (BB-46)

h4. See also
* [[Maryland (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Maryland (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Maryland[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Maryland_(BB-46)]
other_names: メリーランド(艦隊これくしょん)

title: efforia_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]The modern Greek form of "Euphoria". An allusion to his sire's name also being a greek word.[/tn]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Katies Heart.

He is a lighter bay horse with no facial markings and a sock on his left hind leg. He is a somewhat larger than normal horse, weighing between 510 and 520 kg in his prime. He typically ran with a shadow roll.

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 Generation, he is the winner of the 2021 [[Satsuki Sho]]. He had a promising start in his carreer by winning the 2021 Autumn Tenno Sho and the 2021 [[Arima Kinen]] but he slumped in 2022 and his carreer ended after being diagnosed with atrial fibrillation in the aftermath of his failed race at the 2023 Kyoto Kinen.

title: hot_springs_department_member_(blue_archive)
body:
Sprites and mobs in Blue Archive meant to represent the bulk of Gehenna Academy's Hot Springs department, they have 3 variations of the mobs featuring [[green hair]], [[Blue eyes]] and [[beret]], the second (and probably the common) one has [[silver hair]], [[Hard hat]], [[gloves]] and wielding a [[sledgehammer]]. the third one is the same as the second one however has [[blue hair]] and is longer.

These mobs are specialized in Demolitions and creating certain Hot springs in different academies. Their first appearance is from Operation Record of No. 227 Hot Spring Resort.

title: prefect_team_member_(blue_archive)
body: Sprites and mobs in [[Blue Archive]] meant to represent the bulk of Gehenna Academy's [i]gendarmie[/i], the Disciplinary Committee. The sprite is depicted with short, dark hair in a mixed [[hime cut|hime]] and [[bob cut]] with small [[horns]] poking out of either side. The outfit consists of a gray-blue jacket, white button-up shirt, [[red necktie]], dark gray/black [[pleated skirt]], and an [[armband]] bearing the committee's emblem, alongside a military-style cap with Gehenna's logo on a golden shield adorning the front, and the Disciplinary Committee logo on the left side. just like their trinity task force memeber counterparts, these mobs have [[black eyes]].

title: menhera-chan_(ezaki_bisuko)_(character)
body:
Momoka Sakurai, also known as Menhera-chan, is the protagonist of the manga series [[menhera-chan_(ezaki_bisuko)|Wrist-Cut Transformation Subculture Menhera]]. Her name after transformation is Menhera Pink. She has [[pink hair]] with [[twintails]], [[black eyes]], and is often seen wearing a [[white serafuku]] and [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow|hair bows]].

She is usually drawn alongside her pet [[Usatan (ezaki bisuko)|]], a small white [[rabbit]] with pink ears.

title: cremation
body:
The disposal of a dead person's body by burning it to [[ashes]], often serving as a [[funeral]] or post-funeral rite. The ashes of the deceased are collected into [[urns]] to later be buried, enshrined, or scattered. In Japan, the urn may sometimes be placed within a [[kotsubako]], a ceremonial box.

Cremation is [https://web.archive.org/web/20160611020232/http://www.effs.eu/cms/fileadmin/members_only/documents/news_articles/Cremation_statistics_2014.pdf](universal in Japan) compared to Western countries, the former from an imitation of the [[Buddha]] and space concerns and the latter traditionally from the Christian belief in the [[resurrection]] of the flesh.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Cremation":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cremation

title: funeral
body:
A service commemorating someone who has passed away, allowing those close to the deceased to say their final farewells. Funerals often have a somber environment since many people have to cope with the reality that the person is gone, all while having to say good-bye to them at the funeral.

h4. See also

title: mortal_kombat_1_(2023)
body:
The 12th mainline [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, and the fourth game in the post-Armageddon rebooted series.

Follows after [[Mortal Kombat 11]], which ended with the creation of a new timeline under Fire God [[Liu Kang]]. Notably alters the origins of several characters, of note being [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]].

title: big_chungus_(meme)
body:
[b]Big Chungus[/b] refers to an image of the obese [[Bugs Bunny]], usually captioned with the phrase "Big Chungus" and presented as a game for [[PlayStation 4]] console. The image originated from the 1941 [[Looney Tunes]] short [i]"Wabbit Twouble"[/i], showing Bugs mocking [[Elmer Fudd]] (who at the time was depicted as obese) by briefly imitating his appearance.

The word "chungus" was coined by [[video game]] journalist Jim Sterling several years before the meme became popular. Starting in July 2019, the [[meme]] regained ironic popularity on iFunny and certain parts of [[Reddit]], particularly as a part of Reddit Moment memes. The meme's popularity has reached the point that [[Warner Bros]]. has inserted some references to Big Chungus into several media, such as in the mobile game Looney Tunes World of Mayhem and the 2021 film [[Space Jam: A New Legacy]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Big Chungus":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/big-chungus]

title: bugs_bunny
body:
One of the main characters of [[Looney Tunes]] series, later became the de-facto mascot of [[Warner Bros]].

Bugs is a blue-grey [[personification|anthromorphic]] [[rabbit]] with a sharp and quick-witted personality. Most of the time, Bugs often involved in a feud with the hunter [[Elmer Fudd]] and will usually and comically outsmart him.

He is the originator of the, now near universal, misconception that rabbits like to eat [[carrot]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Big Chungus (meme)|]]

title: cyberpunk_(series)
body:

h4. Installments
* Cyberpunk (TTRPG, 1988) - also known as [i]Cyberpunk 2020[/i] and [i]Cyberpunk Red[/i] in later editions.
* [[Cyberpunk 2077]] (video game, 2020)
* [[Cyberpunk Edgerunners]] (anime, 2022)

title: power_pro_kun_pocket
body:
Power Pro-kun Pocket (also known as Pawapoke) is a baseball game/dating sim spinoff of the [[Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu]] series.

Each of the series has various storylines and gal-game-like multiple endings, and there is usually a canon one whose storyline continues on to subsequent games of the series. This series is also well-known for various sci-fi/fantasy storylines and a large number of terrible, depressing endings.

title: chakram
body:
An Indian [[weapon]] in the shape of a circular blade. It can be thrown or used as a melee weapon.

Notable examples include: 
* [[Moriya Suwako]]'s [[Moriya's iron rings|iron rings]] from [[Touhou]]
* [[Tira (soulcalibur)|]]'s various weapons from [[Soulcalibur]]
* [[Axel (kingdom hearts)|]]'s Eternal Flames from [[Kingdom Hearts]]
* [[Dromarch (xenoblade)|]]'s Twin Rings from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]] (mostly wielded by [[Nia (xenoblade)|]])
* [[Mio (xenoblade)|]]'s Twin Moonblades from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]]
* [[Azusa Mifuyu]]'s chakram from [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chakram":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chakram]

title: bon_clay
body:
A character from [[One Piece]].

An okama ballet dancer formerly part of the criminal organization [[Baroque Works]], codename Mister 2 Bon Clay.

Possessing the powers of the Mane Mane no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can impersonate somebody's appearance just by touching them. The extent of his powers also allow him to mix and match body parts.

Real name was revealed as [spoiler]Bentham[/spoiler].

title: cyborg_009
body:
[[Science Fiction]] 1960's manga created by [[Ishinomori Shoutarou]] which has adaptations of 3 movies, (2 from 1960s and one from 1980s), 3 anime and 2 CGI anime movies.

The story follows 9 individuals from different countries captured by the evil organization led by the Black Ghost and transformed into [[cyborg]]s in order to be used as [[war]] weapons. however, a kind [[scientist]] named Dr. [[Isaac Gilmore]] free them and so they all, led by [[Shimamura Joe]] (Cyborg 009) fight for justice in an attempt to defeat the Black Skull and prevent a possible war.

h4. Characters

* 001 - [[Ivan Whisky]]
* 002 - [[Jet Link]]
* 003 - [[Francoise Arnoul]]
* 004 - [[Albert Heinrich]]
* 005 - [[Geronimo Jr]]
* 006 - [[Chang Changku]]
* 007 - [[Great Britain (Cyborg 009)|Great Britain]]
* 008 - [[Pyunma]]
* 009 - [[Shimamura Joe|Joe Shimamura]]

title: science_fiction
body:
A genre of fiction which centers around futuristic science and technology. 

Space travel, [[robot]]s and [[alien]]s, and/or complex [[machine]]ry are common aspects of this genre. Use this tag for images which appear to be set inside of a science fiction universe. 

Scifi and [[fantasy]] often intersect, so feel free to use both tags if you feel it is appropriate.

title: kasukabe_saki
body:
A female character from [[Genshiken]]. 

[b]Kasukabe Saki[/b] is a strong-willed and aggresive down-to-earth, practical, manipulative, and attractive young woman. 

Saki is a somewhat ruthless and easily angered (specially if called [[otaku]]) individual, resorting to physical violence most of the time. She is also a chain smoking person.

[[Madarame Harunobu]] is her nemesis, [spoilers] but Kasukabe ends up becoming one of his best female friends some time later. Saki officially ends up paired with [[Kousaka Makoto]] during the first season of the Genshiken manga series.[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Yukino Satsuki]] in the two original series and OVA productions from Media Blasters, and by [[Satou Rina]] in [[Production IG]]'s Genshiken Nidaime.

title: spine_bumps
body:
When the bumps of the spine are visibly beneath the skin on the back. Eg, post #5470255. Often seen in cases of extreme thinness. Not to be confused with a simple line to indicate the spine eg, post #6218597. This also does not apply to character designs with a transparent body and a visible skeleton beneath it or character designs with spines on the outside/sticking through the skin eg, post #6844681 post #6982123. This tag applies specifically to individual bumps visible underneath non-transparent skin.

h4. See also:

[[ribs]]
[[skinny]]
[[emaciated]]

title: nun_bora_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd and final costume of [[Nijisanji KR]]'s [[Nun Bora]], as seen in post #4909384 and post #4924945, released on November 6, 2021.

This outfit consists of a [[black jacket]] over a [[bodice]] with a [[purple bow]], a [[purple skirt]], [[detached sleeves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] adorned with small [[black bow]]s.

In this appearance Bora is a [[kemonomimi mode]] [[cat girl]] with matching [[cat ears|ears]] and [[cat tail|tail]], and wears her hair in [[twintails]] with two [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]s. This outfit also features an optional [[submachine gun]] accessory.

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[brown cardigan]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[striped bow]], [[diagonal-striped skirt|diagonal-striped]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

title: princess_peach_(happi)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]], depicting her in a [[pink coat|pink]] [[happi]]. also comes with a pair of [[white shorts]] underneath, and [[tabi]], her hair up in a [[ponytail]] with a [[pink headband|pink]] [[hachimaki]].

title: princess_peach_(explorer)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]], depicting her as an explorer. Peach wears a [[brown shirt]] (with a [[pink undershirt]] underneath) with [[short sleeves]] and [[brown shorts|matching shorts]], coming with [[pocket|pockets]], a [[buttons|button]], and a [[black belt]] with a [[belt buckle]]. Also wears a pair of [[white gloves]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], along with a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[hat]] and a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] with a [[map]] in it.

title: princess_peach_(halloween)
body: A slight [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] found on some [[Halloween]] [[official art]] and in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicts her wearing a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[witch hat]] with her usual [[crown]] on top of it, and a short [[purple cape]]. Usually seen holding a [[wand]].

title: princess_peach_(wintertime)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]], meant for [[winter]]. Peach wears a [[grey coat|grey]] [[winter coat]] with [[buttons]] and a pair of [[black gloves]], as well as a [[grey pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. Also wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] and a [[white scarf]] with a [[white bow|matching]] [[bow]] on it.

title: princess_peach_(vacation)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]] that can be found when she takes a vacation. Peach wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], matched with a [[long skirt|long]] [[pink skirt]], held in place with a [[pink belt]] and a gem buckle. Along with it, she wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[sun hat]], a [[pink scarf]] and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]].

title: princess_peach_(sunshine)
body: The [[official alternate costume]] [[Princess Peach]] wears in [[Super Mario Sunshine]]. In it, she trades her usual pink dress for a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress|white one]], as well as ditches her usual gloves and puts her hair up in a [[ponytail]]. Is often seen holding a [[white umbrella|white]] [[parasol]].

title: princess_peach_(swimwear)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]], putting her in a [[swimsuit]]. She wears a [[pink bikini]], the bottoms concealed by a [[white skirt|white]] [[sarong]] with a [[crescent print]] on it. She also wears a pair of [[white-framed eyewear|white]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a pink [[lei]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[sandals]].

title: princess_peach_(wedding)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] in [[Super Mario Odyssey]]. Depicts her as a complete [[bride]], complete with a [[bridal veil]] and [[white dress|white]] [[wedding dress]]. She also wears a [[tiara]] (actually [[Tiara (Mario)|Tiara]]), a [[white choker]] equipped with her usual brooch, and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

title: tomino_yoshiyuki
body:
[b]Tomino Yoshiyuki[/b] (富野 由悠季, born 富野 喜幸 November 5, 1941) is a notable Japanese [[mecha]] anime story creator and writer, responsible for perhaps making [[gundam|the first real robot anime]]. He created and first introduced the now popular term [[mobile suit]] for that series.

Tomino is also infamous for having some series end with numerous characters dying, earning him the nickname "Kill'em All Tomino"  (皆殺しの富野 [i]Minagoroshi no Tomino[/i]).

He has created or co-created such notable works as the U.C. (Universal Century) [[Gundam]] series that started with [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], [[Zeta Gundam]], [[Gundam ZZ]], [[Victory Gundam]], [[Turn A Gundam]], [[Seisenshi Dunbine]], [[Densetsu Kyojin Ideon]], [[Sentou Mecha Xabungle]], [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]], [[Juusenki L-Gaim]], [[Brain Powered]] and [[Overman King Gainer]] among others. His latest work is [[Gundam G No Reconguista]].

Tomino also writes some of the music for his series under the pseudonym "Iogi Rin":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BA%95%E8%8D%BB%E9%BA%9F], such as King Gainer's catchy opening.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino
* Pixiv tag search: "”富野由悠季 (監督 OR 御大)”":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%E5%AF%8C%E9%87%8E%E7%94%B1%E6%82%A0%E5%AD%A3%20%28%E7%9B%A3%E7%9D%A3%20OR%20%E5%BE%A1%E5%A4%A7%29

title: karmatron
body:
The eponymous [[super robot]] main character of the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] [[mexico|Mexican]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] comic series from the 80s.

[b]Karmatron[/b] is a 300 feet tall, red, silver and black armoured spiritual warrior and robotic looking [[mecha]] being who protects good and peace in the universe.

Its name comes from the combination of the word [i]Karma[/i], a mystic word, and the cybernetic term [i]Tron[/i].

Besides its enormous size, Karmatron has also many super powers, including telekinesis, clairvoiyance, energy blasts, astral journeys, flight, space travel, a powerful and almost indestructible armor, a power [[katana]], an ice saber, freezing rays, energy [[boomerang]]s, energy [[shuriken]]s and invisibility.

[spoiler]Karmatron is actually prince [[Zacek]] transformed by the powers of his kalpe-om belt.[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] the character was created by [[Oscar Gonzalez Loyo]] in the 80s.

title: dominion_(manga)
body:
A 1985 [[cyberpunk]] manga written and illustrated by [[Shirow Masamune]]. 

Set in the fictional city of Newport, Japan, in a dystopian future in which infectious diseases as well as air pollution have become so severe that people must wear gas masks when outdoors, the series follows a [[police]] squadron that uses advanced and fast military-style mini-[[tank]]s.

Dominion has been adapted into three original video animation series: the first was released in 1988, the second, [i][[New Dominion Tank Police]][/i] (特捜戦車隊ドミニオン, [i]Tokusō Sensha Tai Dominion[/i]) in 1993, and the third, [i][[Tank Police Team TANK S.W.A.T. 01]][/i] (警察戦車隊TANK S.W.A.T. 01, [i]Keisatsu Sensha Tai TANK S.W.A.T. 01[/i]) in 2006. 

The 1988 OVA is four episodes long and animated by Agent 21, the 1993 OVA is six episodes long and animated by "J.C.Staff":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J.C.Staff, while TANK S.W.A.T. is one episode long and was animated by DOGA Productions using [[3d|CGI]]. 

The manga was published by Hakusensha, Kodansha and later by Seishinsha. It has been published in English by "Dark Horse Comics":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Horse_Comics. 

The anime has been released in English translation in the United Kingdom and Australia by Manga Entertainment and in the United States by Central Park Media, under their U.S. Manga Corps division. The New Dominion Tank Police series was also distributed in the UK, Australia and United States by Manga Entertainment, but later expired. Maiden Japan licensed the six-episode 1993 New Dominion Tank Police OVA series for distribution in North America in 2013.

h4. Related characters

* [[Leona Ozaki]]
* [[Al'Cu Ad Solte]]
* [[Puma Sisters]]

h4. Related vehicles

* [[Bonaparte (tank)]]
other_names: 特捜戦車隊ドミニオン

title: total_recall
body:
[b]Total Recall[/b] is a 1990 American [[cyberpunk]] [[science fiction]] action film. The film stars [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], Rachel Ticotin, Sharon Stone and Michael Ironside. 

It is based on the [[Philip K. Dick]] sci-fi novellete [i]"We Can Remember It for You Wholesale":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/We_Can_Remember_It_for_You_Wholesale[/i] first published in The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction in April 1966. 

The film was directed by Paul Verhoeven and written by Ronald Shusett, Dan O'Bannon, Jon Povill, and Gary Goldman.

h4. See also

* [[melina_(total_recall)|Melina]]

The Bonaparte was built (from the remains of a superior's giant tank she totaled) and piloted by the hot-headed officer [[Leona Ozaki]] and her calm co-pilot [[Al'Cu Ad Solte]].

It was designed by [[Shirow Masamune]] in the 80s. This design influenced the [[Metal Slug]] mini-tank ([[SV001 (Metal Slug)|SV001]]).

title: o/a
body:
A 2009-2012 crude humor comedy manga by [[Watarai Keiji]].  O/A is short for Operation Aurora.

The series revolves around the idol Horiuchi Yutaka and aspiring comedian Tanaka Harumi.  At the start of the series Yutaka gets a gig as the host of a late night radio show once a week.  Due to circumstances, Yutaka ends up unable to host during part of her first show.  Desperate on what to do, the staff realize that the part-timer Harumi sounds just like Yutaka and forces her to host the show in Yutaka's absence.  This coincidence would eventually lead to both girls co-hosting the show while not revealing to the public that there is more than one host.

h4. Characters

* [[Horiuchi Yutaka]]
* [[Tanaka Harumi]]
* [[Kaieda Miho]]

h4. External links

* "Manga Updates: O/A":[https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=48530]

title: savage_model_99
body:
A [[lever action]] centerfire [b][[rifle]][/b] designed "Arthur W. Savage":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_William_Savage and sold by his Savage Arms Company, beginning in 1899 (hence the name). It was a development of the earlier Model 1895, and was intended to compete with Winchester's ones, such as the [[Winchester Model 1894]]. Unlike its competitors, the Savage Model 99 used a rotary [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] instead of a tubular one, and had no external hammer. Although Savage's attempts to garner [[military]] contracts for the Model 99 were unsuccessful, it was a popular civilian sporting [[gun|rifle]] and remained in production until 1998.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Savage 99 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Savage Model 99":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Savage_Model_99

title: natasha_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Natasha[/b] (ナターシャ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]], who is a cleric from the Grado Empire. After discovering the true nature of Emperor [[Vigarde (Fire Emblem)|]], she leaves Grado to warn everyone about this, only to be intercepted by [[Joshua (Fire Emblem)|]], a mercenary hired to kill her. Ironically, after being recruited, she can be used to recruit Joshua into the player’s army as well, and can even marry him if they share an A Support.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] with [[blue eyes]], and a "nice [[smile]]" according to Joshua. She wears a white clerical [[hood]] with a [[white dress]], and is often seen carrying a [[staff]].
other_names: ナターシャ(聖魔の光石)

title: poppi_(xenoblade)
body:
Character from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]. An artificial Blade created by [[Tora (xenoblade 2)|]]. Japanese name: [b]Hana[/b].

Poppi can unlock alternate forms which can be switched between during battle:

* [[Poppi Alpha (xenoblade)|]] (Poppi α): Poppi's original, child-like form with a mostly robotic appearance. Has [[short hair]] with [[twintails]] in the back.
* [[Poppi QT (xenoblade)|]] ("Quixotic Tutelar"): Poppi's second form, with a teenage and more human-like appearance. Wears a [[maid]] outfit.
* [spoiler][[Poppi QTPI (xenoblade)|]] ("Quantum Technochampion π"): Poppi's final form, and the most mature in appearance. Wears a [[mecha musume]]-like outfit with a [[highleg leotard]] and has [[long hair]].[/spoiler]

title: rokujouma_no_shinryakusha!?
body:
Light novel series written by Takehaya and illustrated by [[poco_(asahi_age)|Poco]]. 
As a collaborative event, [[Higashihongan Sanae]], [[Nijino Yurika]], [[Kurano Kiriha]] and [[Theiamillis Gre Fortorthe]] are also featured in the Third-Person Shooter MMO [[Cosmic Break]] as playable characters.

Synopsis :

[[Satomi Koutarou]] decided to live on his own when he began high school.

Fortunately, he discovered Room 106 of Corona House, small "rokujouma" (6-tatami apartment), that only cost 5000 yen a month.

Unfortunately, he also discovered that numerous otherworldly and supernatural girls also wanted his room for various reasons of their own, and none of them were about to back down.

As a result, Koutarou and the girls found themselves forced to live together as they tried to settle just who would end up with the room.

title: t-55
body:
Early [[Cold War]] period [[Soviet]] main battle [[tank]]. 

Combined a large [[cannon]], good crew protection, and speed in under 40 tons. Over 100k were produced (including those under licence in various "Warsaw Pact":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact countries and [[China]]) making it one of the most produced tanks of all time. 

Fought in numerous wars in the Middle East, Africa, Balkans, and Asia. Currently still in service in front line units in a number of nations, as well as in reserve in more.

title: t-44
body:
Intended successor [[tank]] of the [[T-34]], possessing the same armaments as the [[T-34-85]] with a new and improved hull. 

Entered production but not in great numbers. Further development lead to the [[T-54 (Soviet)]], [[T-55]] series.

title: neo_geo
body:
[b]Neo Geo[/b] (ネオジオ?) is a family of [[video game]] hardware developed by [[SNK]]. 

The brand originated in 1990 with the release of an arcade system, the Neo Geo MVS and its home console counterpart, the Neo Geo AES. Both the arcade system and console were very very powerful for the time and the AES allowed for perfect ports of 2D games released for the arcade MVS with superior colors and sound. 

However, the equally very very high price point for both the console and its games prevented it from directly competing with its contemporaries, the [[Sega Mega Drive]] and [[super_nintendo|Super Nintendo Entertainment System]].

Years later, SNK would release the Neo Geo CD, a more cost effective console with games released on compact discs. The console was met with limited success, due in part to its slow CD-ROM drive. 

In an attempt to compete with increasingly popular 3D games, SNK released the Hyper Neo Geo 64 arcade system in 1997 as the successor to its aging MVS. The system did not fare well and only a few titles were released for it. A planned home console based on the hardware was never released. 

SNK later extended the brand by releasing two handheld consoles, the Neo Geo Pocket and Neo Geo Pocket Color, which briefly competed with Nintendo's Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance. Soon after their release, SNK encountered various legal and financial issues and the Neo Geo brand was officially discontinued in 2004.

Despite the failure of later Neo Geo hardware, games for the original MVS and AES were very well received. The system spawned several long-running series, including [[The King of Fighters]] and [[Samurai Spirits|Samurai Shodown]]. Later releases like the [[Metal Slug]] games ensured that the hardware had quite a long lifespan. 

Homebrew video games for the system have also been released and the AES system along with its games are popular among collectors, with many AES items still fetching high prices at auction. In 2012, SNK Playmore announced that it was revisiting the brand with a handheld console based on the original AES, under the name [i]Neo Geo X[/i].

title: zaku_ii_s
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime show from 1979.

[b]MS-06S Zaku II Commander Type[/b]

The definitive command unit based on the reliable if unimpressive [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]]. While being visually almost completely indistinguishable from a standard model, notably only by its Commander [[Radio Antenna]] and extra [[thrusters]] on the feet area, its greatly superior performance was usually what tipped off its enemies - shortly followed by their imminent demise. 

Despite being very common among [[Zeon]]'s ranks, the most famous unit was definitely the [[zaku_ii_s_char_custom|red Zaku II]] piloted by [[Char Aznable]], "the Red Comet", whose piloting skills and prowess created the myth that his suit was capable of moving at three times the speed of a regular [[Zaku]].

title: descent_shuttle_horizont
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] form the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]Descent Shuttle Horizont[/b] is a type of human combat [[space shuttle]] designed for [[atmospheric reentry]] operations. The Horizont is the smallest of the ships used by the [[Mars Base (kikou souseiki mospeada)|]] Second and the Jupiter Base Third Earth Reclamation Invasion Fleets and they were painted white and blue. The Horizonts that took part in the Third Invasion Fleet were painted red and dark gray.

The shuttle is also designed to deliver two assault pods attached to its wings. Each assault pod functions as a command post that, once firmly on the ground, opens its hatch and releases [[mospeada (mecha)]] troops to join the ground assault forces. 

Each Horizont also carries a [[Legioss]] [[mecha]] attached to a [[Tread]] on its underside that is released to fight in orbit and escort the Horizont as it lands on the planet.

He once ate the Moku Moku no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], which allows him to turn himself into plumes of smoke and to generate and control smoke.

Often seen smoking two [[cigar|cigars]] at once.

title: sniper_team
body:
A [[military]] unit consisting of two or more people. At minimum there is the sniper who is responsible for taking out targets, and the Spotter who relays information on the target (distance, wind speed and direction,  etc.) to the sniper. Additional members includes different snipers for short, medium, and long range targets, Flankers who are assigned to protect the team while it is in position, and Coordinators who helps the team communicate with different teams. 

A sniper team can also be made up of special forces [[military operator|operatives]].

h4. see also

* [[Military operator]]

title: retort
body:
A device used for distillation or dry distillation of substances. It consists of a spherical vessel with a long downward-pointing neck. 

The liquid to be distilled is placed in the vessel and heated. The neck acts as a condenser, allowing the vapors to condense and flow along the neck to a collection vessel placed underneath.

h1. See also

* [[beaker]]
* [[test tube]]
* [[science]]

title: drydock
body:
A narrow basin or vessel that can be [[flood|flooded]] to allow a load to be floated in, then drained to allow that load to come to rest on a dry platform. 

Used for the construction, maintenance, and repair of [[ship|ships]], [[ship|boats]], and other [[watercraft]].

h1. See also

* [[tag group:locations]]

title: observatory
body:
A location used for observing [[earth_(planet)|terrestrial]], [[ocean|marine]], or [[space|celestial]] events. 

[[Astronomy]], climatology/meteorology, geophysics, oceanography and [[volcano|volcanology]] are examples of disciplines for which [[observatory|observatories]] have been constructed.

title: astronomy
body:
A natural [[science]] that studies celestial objects and the phenomena that occur in the [[space|cosmos]]. 

It uses [[math|mathematics]], physics, and [[chemistry]].

title: mall
body:
When referring to a location, a [[mall]] is a large [[indoors|indoor]] [[shopping]] center, usually anchored by department [[shop|stores]]. 

The term [[mall]] originally meant a pedestrian promenade with [[shop|shops]] along it, but in the late 1960s, it began to be used as a generic term for the large enclosed [[shop|shopping]] centers that were becoming increasingly commonplace.

title: arabia
body:
The [b]Arabian Peninsula[/b] (Arabic: شبه الجزيرة العربية‎ shibh al-jazīrat al-ʻarabīyah or جزيرة العرب jazīrat al-ʻArab) is a land mass situated north-east of [[Africa]]. Also known as [b]Arabia[/b] or the [b]Arabian Subcontinent[/b], it is the world's largest peninsula and covers 3,237,500 km2 (1,250,000 mi2).

The area is an important part of the Asian continent and plays a critical geopolitical role of the Middle East and Arab World due to its vast reserves of oil and natural gas. 

The peninsula formed as a result of the rifting of the Red Sea between 56 and 23 million years ago, and is bordered by the Red Sea to the west, the Persian Gulf to the northeast, and the Indian Ocean to the southeast.

title: marseille
body:
Marseille is the prefecture of the French department of Bouches-du-Rhône and capital of the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region. Situated in the camargue region of southern France, it is located on the coast of the Gulf of Lion, part of the Mediterranean Sea, near the mouth of the Rhône river. Its inhabitants are called Marseillais.

Marseille is the second most populous city in France, with 870,731 inhabitants in 2019 (Jan. census) over a municipal territory of 241 km2 (93 sq mi). Together with its suburbs and exurbs, the Marseille metropolitan area, which extends over 3,972 km2 (1,534 sq mi), had a population of 1,873,270 at the Jan. 2019 census, the third most populated in France after those of Paris and Lyon. The cities of Marseille, Aix-en-Provence, and 90 suburban municipalities have formed since 2016 the Aix-Marseille-Provence Metropolis, an indirectly elected metropolitan authority now in charge of wider metropolitan issues, with a population of 1,898,561 at the Jan. 2019 census.

Founded around 600 BC by Greek settlers from Phocaea, Marseille is the oldest city in [[France]], as well as one of Europe's oldest continuously inhabited settlements. It was known to the ancient Greeks as Massalia and to Romans as Massilia. Marseille has been a trading port since ancient times. In particular, it experienced a considerable commercial boom during the colonial period and especially during the 19th century, becoming a prosperous industrial and trading city. Nowadays the Old Port still lies at the heart of the city where the manufacturing of soap, its famous savon de Marseille, began some 6 centuries ago. Overlooking the port is the Basilica of Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde or "Bonne-mère" for the people of Marseille, a Romano-Byzantine church and the symbol of the city. Inherited from this past, the Grand Port Maritime de Marseille (GPMM) and the maritime economy are major poles of regional and national activity and Marseille remains the first French port, the second Mediterranean port and the fifth European port. Since its origins, Marseille's openness to the Mediterranean Sea has made it a cosmopolitan city marked by cultural and economic exchanges with Southern Europe, the Middle East, North Africa and Asia. In Europe, the city has the third largest Jewish community after [[London]] and [[Paris]].

h4. Landmarks
* [[Notre Dame de la Garde]]
* [[Vieux-Port de Marseille]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marseille

title: satan_(devilman)
body:
[[Devilman]] character.

[spoilers][[Asuka Ryou]]'s true identity. Hermaphrodite. 
He and his army of demons hibernated for two million years after a battle against God, only to find out that human beings had taken over Earth in the meantime. To infiltrate their society and understand them more, Satan got his memories replaced with the ones belonging to a recently deceased human - a young man named Asuka Ryou. During his human life as Ryou, Satan met [[Fudou Akira]] and became his best friend, later encouraging him to become a devilman to protect humanity from demons.

Only after demons officially declared war against humans, he got his memory back. Despite having developed romantic feelings for Akira, Satan led his army until the end, wiping out humanity.[/spoilers]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/飛鳥了]

title: help:user_settings
body:
Description "user settings":/settings.

h4. Basic Settings

* [b]Name[/b]
** Requests a username change
* [b]Password[/b]
** Changes the user password
* [b]Email[/b]
** Changes the email address
* [b]Theme[/b]
** Chooses the site's color scheme
* [b]Safe mode[/b]
** [b]True[/b] - The same as using "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe]. In addition to hiding non-{{rating:general}} posts, [u]censored tags[/u] will also be hidden for all member levels ([[Help:Censored Tags]]).
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - All images will be displayed except for [u]censored tags[/u] for certain member levels.
* [b]Posts per page[/b]
** Sets the max number of posts shown on a single page
* [b]Default image width[/b]
** [b]Original[/b] - Will always show the full-size image
** [b]850px[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - Will show the sample image with a max width of 850 pixels
* [b]Receive email notifications[/b] 
** [b]True[/b] - Receive an email when you get a new Dmail
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - No emails will be sent
* [b]Timezone[/b]
** Sets how timestamps are displayed
** Affects how the [code]date:[/code] metatag works ("Help:Cheatsheet":[/wiki_pages/43049#dtext-n2-2-2])
** Default is Eastern Time (US & Canada)
* [b]Comment threshold[/b]
** Comments below this score will be hidden by default
* [b]Blacklisted tags[/b]
** Put any tag combinations you never want to see here
** Each combination should go on a separate line
** You can also whitelist tags by adding a minus sign "-" in front
** See [[Help:Blacklists]] for more information

h4. Advanced Settings

* [b]Account[/b]
** Permanent deactivate your account
[tn]...and other various settings (with description).[/tn]

title: ogre
body:
A general group of large and aggressive humanoid [[monster]]. They are often depicted with a large head, abundant hair and beard, a voracious appetite, and a strong body.

As they are commonly mistaken for [[orc]] due to naming similarity and similar characteristics, later depiction of ogres usually have a [[colored skin]] (typically brown or red, similar to [[oni]], albeit some artist is still using green skin, however), a [[horns|horn]](s), as well as usually being [[fat]] instead of [[muscular]].

Note that this tag is used specifically for the "western" ogres (human-like ogres and derivatives). For Japanese ogres, uses [[oni]] instead.

For the [[Tekken]] character, see [[Ogre (Tekken)]]. 

h4. See also 

* [[Shrek (series)]]
* [[giant]] 
* [[oni]] 
* [[orc]] 
* [[troll]] 
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: pancor_jackhammer
body:
The [b]Pancor Jackhammer[/b] is a 12-gauge [[bullpup]] automatic [b][[shotgun]][/b]. Designed in 1984 by John A. Anderson, who formed the company Pancor Industries in New Mexico, [[united states|USA]]. Patented in 1987. Despite not being successful, the weapon is frequently featured in some films, television shows as well as [[video game]]s due to its distinct futuristic appearance.

The unconventional mechanism of Pancor Jackhammer can best be described as a gas-operated [[revolver]]. Layout consisted of a bullpup configuration with a detachable 10-[[shotgun shell|round]] revolving cylinder. The cylinder's method of rotation was very similar to the [[Webley-Fosbery Automatic Revolver]], an operating rod being used to rotate the cylinder, although [b]gas-operated[/b] as opposed to the recoil operation of the Webley-Fosbery. 

h1. See also
* [[combat shotgun]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[MK3A1 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Pancor Jackhammer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pancor_Jackhammer]
other_names: パンコアジャックハンマー

title: inglourious_basterds
body:
A 2009 alternate history war film written and directed by [b][[Quentin Tarantino]][/b], starring [[Brad Pitt]], [[Christoph Waltz]], and [[Michael Fassbender]] among others. It follows the story of a Jewish [[united states army|U.S Army squad]] known as "The Basterds" and a Jewish French [[movie theater|cinema]] owner’s overlapping plans to assassinate the [[Nazi]] high command.

It was Tarantino's sixth main film and generally received positive reviews, many of them praising Christoph Waltz's performance as the main villain, SS Colonel [[Hans Landa]]. It was also Christoph Waltz's debut as a mainstream Hollywood actor.
other_names: イングロリアス・バスターズ

title: hans_landa

title: new_nambu_m60
body:
The [b]New Nambu M60[/b] is a Japanese five-shot, double-action [[revolver]] chambered in .38 Special based upon Smith & Wesson-style designs. Introduced in 1960 for [[police]] use. It was designed and produced by Shin-Chuō Industries, later merged with Minebea.
The [[handgun|gun]] was named after a prominent [[weapon|arms]] designer Kijirou Nambu.

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[brown cardigan]], [[white shirt]], [[red bow]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

title: t-70_x-wing
body:
A fictional spacecraft from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise, first appearing in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

The [i]Incom Corporation[/i] [b]T-70 X-Wing[/b] [[Starfighter]] is a newer variation of the old [[T-65 X-Wing]] and shares the same role and shape of the classic ship, being even faster, better armed and armored -as well as more maneuverable- than its predecessor.

The design of this new X-Wing strongly resembles the early concept designs by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie for the first X-Wing in the [[Star Wars: A New Hope|Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope]] film from 1977.

title: salute
body:
A gesture of greeting and respect, typically a hand raised in the air.

h6. Salute Tags

* [[straight-arm salute]]
* [[two-finger salute]]
* [[vulcan salute]]

h6. Official national forms vary from country to country:

* American: forearm at 45° angle to the forehead, blade hand with palm towards face.
* British: similar to American, but with palm facing outward.
* Straight-arm salute (also called Roman, Hitler or Nazi salute and was used by fascist or Nazi movements and governments, most notably Nazi Germany): straight arm extended forward and upwards.

h6. Stylized forms appear in many [[magical girl]] titles:

* [[Sailor Moon]] in particular popularized the "V" hand held sideways, partially framing the eye. This was later inherited by [[Asamiya Athena]] from [[the King of Fighters '96|KOF 96]] onwards
* In [[Final Fantasy VIII]], [[Rinoa Heartilly]] gestures with an upward pointing index finger.

h6. Other well-known forms:

* [[palm-fist greeting|Kung fu]]: a closed fist wrapped in an open palm, often with a slight bow
* Peace/Victory: outward palm with index and middle finger extended, arm extended forward
* Love: opposing thumbs and index fingers join at the fingertips in the shape of a heart; other fingers may suggest wings

h1. See also

* [[grabbing own ass]]

title: thigh_grab
body:
When a character is grabbing another's [[thighs|thigh]] or [[thighs|both thighs]].

h1. See also

* [[torso grab]]
* [[ass grab]]
* [[leg grab]]

title: motosu_school_uniform
body:
The school [[school uniform]] from Mototsu high school from [[yurucamp]].

It's a [[serafuku]] consisting of a dark [[blue sailor collar]] with a [[white neckerchief]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[yellow sweater]] a [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[blue_skirt|dark blue]]/[[grey_skirt|grey]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

Since the manga/anime takes place during winter it's unclear if there is a summer version of the uniform, although flashbacks from middle school show characters wearing a short-sleeved white shirt.

title: hands_on_own_legs
body:
When both of a character's hands are on their [[legs]].

If a single hand is involved, use [[hand on own leg]].

h1. See also

* [[hands on own thighs]]
* [[hands on own hips]]

title: hand_on_own_leg
body:
When a character's hand is on their [[legs|leg]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own legs]].

h1. See also

* [[hand on own thigh]]
* [[hand on own hip]]

title: feather_trim
body: Similar to a [[fur trim]], but with [[feathers]] instead of [[fur]]. Usually done on [[feather-trimmed_sleeves|sleeves]].

title: energy_wings
body: A [[wings|wing]] type formed using some form of [[energy]] (typically [[magic|magical]]). Often [[detached wings|detached]], but can also be attached to the character.

title: about:note_formatting
body:
[expand=Table of Contents] * 1. "Introduction":#dtext-intro * 2. "Basic markup":#dtext-basic * 3. "Intermediate markup":#dtext-intermediate * 4. "Advanced markup":#dtext-advanced * 5. "Useful style combinations":#dtext-useful * 6. "Other allowed tags":#dtext-other-tag * 7. "Other allowed style properties":#dtext-other-style [/expand] h4#intro.Introduction Danbooru's translation note system allows users to include HTML markup alongside note text. It uses restricted [b]HTML[/b] formatting in contrast to most of Danbooru, which uses [b]DText[/b] formatting. h4#basic.Basic markup This section describes the most common and easy to use tags. * [code][/code] - Bolds text ([b]example[/b]). * [code][/code] - Italicizes text ([i]example[/i]). * [code][/code] - Strikes out text ([s]Example[/s]). * [code][/code] - Underlines text ([u]Example[/u]). * [code][/code] - Increases the font size of text. * [code][/code] - Decreases the font size of text. * To display an actual "<" or ">" character, use the following: ** [code]<[/code] - "<", i.e. less than. ** [code]>[/code] - ">", i.e. greater than. * [code][/code] - A Danbooru-specific tag for translator's notes, i.e. clarifying remarks on the actual translation. It adds a line break and makes enclosed text small and gray. ** For purposes of consistency, all translator's notes should use this tag, and do not need to be indicated with 'TL:', 'N.B.', or any other such identifier. ** The [code][/code] tag should [i]not[/i] be used for other purposes, such as sound effects - consider using italics for that. h4#intermediate. Intermediate markup This section deals with more complex markup, allowing to include hyper-links, align text, and separate text. h5#attributes. Attributes HTML tags can be assigned attributes to achieve various effects. Attributes always take the format of [code]attribute="attribute text"[/code] . [code]
[/code] h5. Hyper-links These use the [code] tag. They can be used to link to any internal/external webpages. [expand=Details] The link is assigned using the [code]href[/code] attribute, and the link text goes inbetween the enclosing [code][/code] tags. [b]Example:[/b] [code] Link text [/code] Pages that are internal to Danbooru can use relative links, i.e. the URL without the domain attached. [b]Example:[/b] [code] Link to post #1234 [/code] Elements on the same page can be linked to using anchor links, which are hashtags "#" followed by the ID of the element being linked to. [b]Example:[/b] [code] Link to the artist commentary [/code] [/expand] h5. FONT tag This is the [code][/code] tag. [b]DO NOT USE THIS TAG![/b] It has been deprecated in HTML5, and will cause all stylings set with it to no longer function when Danbooru converts to using it. See [[About:Note Fonts]] for information on changing the font instead. h5. SPAN tag This is the [code][/code] tag. It is a basic inline tag. [expand=Details] Use it to encapsulate text that should go on the same line as text before and/or after it. [b]Example:[/b] [code] This is some basic inline text. [/code] [/expand] h5. DIV tag This is the [code]
[/code] tag. It is a basic block tag. [expand=Details] Use it to encapsulate text that are on separate lines. [b]Example:[/b] [code]
Block line 1
Block line 2
[/code] Both of the above will go on separate lines. [/expand] h5. P tag This is the [code]

[/code] tag. It is a basic block tag. [expand=Details] It has a few key differences from the [code]

[/code] tag. * 1. It adds an extra line-break if it is not the last HTML tag in note. * 2. It cannot be used to encapsulate other block tags like [code]
[/code] or another [code]

[/code] . [/expand] h5#tn-tag. TN tag This is the [code][/code] tag. It is used to specifiy text for translation notes. [expand=Details] As "mentioned above":[#dtext-basic], its use is internal to Danbooru only. Under the covers, it is in actuality the [code]

[/code] tag. So the following: [code] Translation text. [/code] ...becomes the following: [code]

Translation text.

[/code] As shown above, the size and color the the translator text is added by using the [code]class[/code] attribute set with the value "tn". The same can be done with any other HTML tag. This is useful if one doesn't want to have a line-break added, like a translation note at the top of the HTML. [b]Example:[/b] [code]
[Background text]
[/code] [/expand] h6#align. Align attribute The [code]align[/code] attribute allows one to specify the text alignment of the encapsulated text. [expand=Details] * [code]center[/code] - Center aligned text. * [code]left[/code] - Left aligned text. * [code]right[/code] - Right aligned text. * [code]justify[/code] - Text is spaced to fill the entire block. [code]
Text that is center aligned.
[/code] [b]Note:[/b] Only the [code]
[/code] and [code]

[/code] tags accept the [code]align[/code] attribute. [/expand] h4#advanced. Advanced markup The following section deals with even more complex markup, which can be used to further style the text in the notes. h5. Class attribute This attribute can be used to add preprogrammed styles to a note. [expand=Details] One example was shown above with "translator notes":[#dtext-tn-tag]. Multiple classes can be used with this attribute. Each class must be separated by a space. [code] Translator text with a margin bottom of 16px. [/code] Other available classes can be found looking through Danbooru's style sheets. [/expand] h5. Style attribute This attribute is how most stylings should be applied to notes. [expand=Details] This attribute can have one or more CSS properties added. Each property ends with a colon ":" with the value of that property ending in a semi-colon ";" . [b]Example:[/b] [code] Text that is 18 pixels and red. [/code] [/expand] h6#color. Color property The [code]color[/code] property specifies the color of the text. [expand=Details] It takes the following values. * Color name, e.g. [code]red[/code]. * RGB hexadecimal value, e.g. [code]#444[/code] or [code]#123456[/code]. ** 3-digit hex codes mirror the first digit onto the second, e.g. #123 is actually #112233. * RGB function, e.g. [code]rgb(255, 42, 22)[/code] ** Values are decimal format. * HSL function, e.g. [code]hsl(120, 100%, 50%)[/code] ** Hue is 0 to 360, saturation and lightness are 0 to 100% Alpha transparency can also be added by adding an extra 2 digits to the hex format or using the RGBA/HSLA functions. The values are 00-FF for hex, and 0.0 to 1.0 for RGBA/HSLA. * The codes [code]#000fdbA1[/code], [code]rgba(0, 15, 219, 0.63/63%)[/code] and [code]hsla(236, 100%, 43%, 0.63/63%)[/code] all correspond to the same color with 63% transparency level. [b]Example:[/b] [code] Text that is red. [/code] [/expand] h6#font-size. Font size property The [code]font-size[/code] property specifies the size of the text. [expand=Details] It takes the following values. * [b]Absolute size[/b] ** Zero, e.g. [code]0[/code] ** Pixels, e.g. [code]18px[/code]. ** Centimeters, e.g. [code]0.5cm[/code] ** Millimeters, e.g. [code]50mm[/code] ** Inches, e.g. [code]0.25in[/code] ** Names, e.g. [code]large[/code]. *** Available names: xx-small, x-small, small, medium, large, x-large, xx-large * [b]Relative sizes[/b] ** Percentage, e.g. [code]%100[/code]. *** Relative the the parent element's [code]font-size[/code]. ** EM (element multiply), e.g. [code]3em[/code]. *** Relative the the parent element's [code]font-size[/code], so 3em is 3x the parent's font-size. ** REM (root element multiply), e.g. [code]3rem[/code]. *** Relative the the root element's [code]font-size[/code] (usually 16px), so 3em is 3 x 16px or 48px. * Names, e.g. [code]larger[/code]. ** Available names: smaller, larger [code] Text that is 18 pixels. [/code] Tip: Use relative sizes whenever possible. Doing so makes notes more likely to display correctly when viewed on differently sized displays. [/expand] h6#background-color. Background color property The [code]background-color[/code] property specifies the color of the area contained by the element and its padding. [expand=Details] It takes the same values as the "color property":[#dtext-color]. The amount of area filled depends on the "size":[#dtext-size] and "padding":[#dtext-padding] of the HTML element, as well as whether the HTML element is an inline or block tag. [code] Background color is yellow. [/code] [/expand] h6#background. Background The [code]background[/code] property is the shorthand property that also allow you repeating patterns and gradient backgrounds. [expand=Details] For gradient backgrounds, it works like [code]background-image[/code] from CSS (it doesn't work if you change it to [code]background-image[/code]). [code]

That text has a left to right red-blue gradient background.
[/code] [/expand] h6#text-align. Text align The [code]text-align[/code] property specifies the alignment in the encapsulated text. [expand=Details] It takes the same values as the "align attribute":[#dtext-align]. [code]
Text that is center aligned.
[/code] [/expand] h6#padding. Padding The [code]padding[/code] property specifies the area between the element and the border if there is one. [expand=Details] can take the same values as the "font-size property":[#dtext-font-size]. The EM and % values are relative to the element's [code]font-size[/code]. The number of values specified determines which sides get which value. * 1 value, e.g. [code]padding: 18px[/code] ** All 4 sides get the value of 18px * 2 values, e.g. [code]padding: 18px 0[/code] ** Top and bottom are 18px, left and right are 0 * 3 values, e.g. [code]padding: 18px 0 24px[/code] ** Top is 18px, left and right are 0, bottom is 24px * 4 values, e.g. [code]padding: 18px 0 24px 5px[/code] ** Top is 18px, right is 0, bottom is 24px, left is 5px Instead of using [code]padding[/code], individual sides can be specified by using [code]padding-top[/code], [code]padding-bottom[/code], [code]padding-left[/code], or [code]padding-right[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] Top and bottom padding do not work with inline elements such as [code][/code] . [/expand] h6#margin. Margin The [code]margin[/code] property specifies the area between the border (if there is one) and the surrounding elements. [expand=Details] It follows the same values and format as the "padding property":[#dtext-padding]. Unlike with padding, margin values can be negative, e.g. "-24px". This effectively pulls it closer to other elements, to the point where it can overlap. [b]Note:[/b] Top and bottom margins do not work with inline elements such as [code][/code] . [/expand] h6#text-shadow. Text-shadow The [code]text-shadow[/code] property allows one to add shadows to an element's text. [expand=Details] It uses values from both the "color property":[#dtext-color] and the "font-size property":[#dtext-font-size]. It specifies the position, bluriness, and color of text which will shadow the encapsulating text. Multiple shadows can be specified by separating each value by a comma ",". * [b]Format:[/b] [code]x-position y-position blur-radius color[/code] ** x-position (required, size parameter) ** y-position (required, size parameter) ** blur-radius (optional, size parameter) *** Defaults to 0 when not specified. ** color (optiona, color parameter) *** Defaults to the element's color when not specified. If only the [code]blur-radius[/code] or [code]color[/code] is specified, it will interpret the value based upon whether it is a size or color value. If it is a size value, it will be the [b]blur-radius[/b], if it is a color value, it will be the [code]color[/code]. [b]Example:[/b] [code]
Text with 2 shadows with different colors, position, and bluriness.
[/code] [/expand] h6#white-space. White-space The [code]white-space[/code] property allows one to control how whitespace and text wrapping are handled. [expand=Details] This property controls whether two different kinds of character substitutions are made: * If multiple whitespace characters appear consecutively, they can be replaced with a single character, causing sequences of spaces to be replaced with a single space. This also removes leading or trailing whitespace from a line. * If a line of text is determined to be too long to fit inside the note's current width, automatic text wrapping can be performed by replacing a whitespace character with a line break. The possible values of this property are as follows: * [code]normal[/code] - Collapse sequences of whitespace and wrap text when necessary. This is the default * [code]nowrap[/code] - Collapse sequences of whitespace, wrap text only at line breaks. * [code]pre[/code] - Whitespace is preserved, wrap text only at line breaks. * [code]pre-line[/code] - Same as [code]normal[/code](?) * [code]pre-wrap[/code] - Whitespace is preserved, wrap text when necessary. When using [code]nowrap[/code] or [code]pre[/code], the note box will resize to fit the longer line. When suppressing text wrapping, keep in mind your notes should be accessible to users on all platforms. Mobile users have dramatically less screen width than PC users, and notes that are too wide may go off both sides of the screen. As an alternative to this property, you might consider using a non-breaking space by entering [code] [/code]. As its name implies, a non-breaking space prevents text wrapping from occurring where it is used, forcing the words before and after it to be on the same line. It otherwise is visually identical to an ordinary space. [b]Examples:[/b] [code]
This is a really long line of text which doesn't contain any line breaks. When used in a note, the nowrap value prevents it from wrapping to a new line no matter what, even if the note ends up going off the screen.
[/code] [code]
▲ ▲ ▲
▲ ▲ ▲
[/code] [/expand] h6#transform. Transform The [code]transform[/code] property allows one to change the size and orientation of an element. [expand=Details] It can use the following functions. * [b]Size parameter transforms[/b] ** These transforms use the "font-size":[#dtext-font-size] values. ** [code]translate(x, y)[/code] - Translates (moves) the element. *** [code]translateX[/code] and [code]translateY[/code] functions are also available which only affects the specified axis. ** [code]scale(x, y)[/code] - Scales (resizes) the element. Uses scalar values, e.g. "3.0" is 3 times the current size. *** [code]scaleX[/code] and [code]scaleY[/code] functions are also available which only affects the specified axis. * [b]Angle parameter transforms[/b] ** These transforms use "deg" for degrees, "rad" for radians, and "turn" which is equivalent to 360 degrees. *** E.g. "30deg", "1.25rad", "0.5turn" ** [code]rotate(angle)[/code] - Rotates the element. ** [code]skew(x-angle, y-angle)[/code] - Rotates the element. *** [code]skewX[/code] and [code]skewY[/code] functions are also available which only affects the specified axis. Multiple transforms are stackable by separating each transform by a space. [b]Examples:[/b] [code]
Scales the X axis by 2, moves it to the right by 2em, and rotates it 30 degrees.
[/code] [/expand] h5. Position Precise positioning of text can be achieved by using the [code]position[/code] property. [expand=Details] First set the parent element with [code]position:relative[/code], as well as setting the height and width. Then set the sub-elements with [code]position:absolute[/code] , then use left / right and top / bottom to place the sub-element text relative to the parent element. [code]
Chirp
Chirp
Chirp
Chirp
[/code] [b]Note:[/b] Since the sub-elements are using absolute positions, the whitespace between the sub-elements no longer matters. [/expand] h5. Title attribute The [code]title[/code] attribute can be used to add popup text to any element, which will appear when the user hovers over it with the pointer. [expand=Example] [code]
The main text.
[/code] [/expand] h5. RUBY tag This is the [code][/code] tag. It is an inline tag, and allows one to place smaller pronounciation/explanatory text over other text, much like how Furigana can go over Kanji. [expand=Details] It works in concert with the [code][/code] and [code][/code] tags. Inside the [code][/code] element goes pairs of [code][/code] and [code][/code] elements. The [code][/code] specifies the bottom text, and the [code][/code] specifies the top text. Order matters, and so the [code][/code] element must always go before the [code][/code] element. [b]Example:[/b] [code] 誕tan生jou日bi [/code] [/expand] h4#useful. Useful style combinations h5. Text outline [code]text-shadow: -1px -1px #000, 1px -1px 0 #000, -1px 1px 0 #000, 1px 1px 0 #000;[/code] h5. Upside-down text [code]transform: rotate(180deg);[/code] h5. Mirrored text (Left-Right) [code]transform: scaleX(-1);[/code] h5. Mirrored text (Top-Bottom) [code]transform: scaleY(-1);[/code] h4#other-tag. Other allowed tags Note that any attributes for those tags but the [code]style[/code] and [code]title[/code] attributes will be filtered out. [expand] h5. Block tags * [code][/code] - creates a block of text using monospace font * [code]
[/code] - creates a centered block of text * [code]
[/code] - creates block of text styled as a quote * [code]
[/code] - creates a block of text inside which any HTML markup is not processed and left as-is.

h5. Header tags

* [code]
[/code], [code]
[/code], [code]
[/code], [code]
[/code], [code]
[/code], [code]
[/code]  

h5. List tags

* [code]
    [/code]
* [code]
  • [/code]
* [code]
      [/code]

h5. Misc

* [code][/code] - Same as [code][/code] .
* [code][/code] - Same as [code][/code] .

[/expand]

h4#other-style. Other allowed style properties

[expand]

* align-items
* background-clip, -webkit-background-clip
* background-color
* border, border-color, border-image, border-radius, border-style, border-width
* border-bottom, border-bottom-color, border-bottom-left-radius, border-bottom-right-radius, border-bottom-style, border-bottom-width
* border-left, border-left-color, border-left-style, border-left-width
* border-right, border-right-color, border-right-style, border-right-width
* border-top, border-top-color, border-top-left-radius, border-top-right-radius, border-top-style, border-top-width
* bottom, left, right, top
* box-shadow
* display
* filter
* float
* font, font-family, font-size-adjust, font-style, font-variant, font-weight
* height, width
* justify-content
* letter-spacing
* line-height
* opacity
* perspective, perspective-origin
* text-align
* text-decoration
* text-indent
* text-shadow
* transform-origin
* -webkit-text-fill-color
* -webkit-text-stroke, -webkit-text-stroke-color, -webkit-text-stroke-width
* white-space
* word-break
* word-spacing
* word-wrap, overflow-wrap
* writing-mode
* vertical-align

[/expand]

title: senki_zesshou_symphogear
body:
A 2012 anime by Encourage Films and [[Satelight]]. The second season aired in summer 2013, the third in summer 2015, the fourth in summer 2017, and a fifth in summer 2019. 
The fourth and fifth seasons were announced to have been greenlit during the Symphogear Live 2016 event held on February 27-28.

The titular Symphogears are miracle powersuits powered by singing and used to fight an alien other-dimensional enemy called [[noise (symphogear)|Noise]]. 
The series is known for its popular character songs, over the top action packed seasons and [[yuri]] subtext. 

A gacha game [i][[Senki Zesshou Symphogear XD Unlimited]][/i] was released on June 26, 2017.

h4. Characters (Symphogear)

* [[Amou Kanade]]
* [[Fine (Symphogear)|Finé]]
* [[Fujitaka Sakuya]]
* [[Kazanari Genjuurou]]

title: burning_force
body:
[b]Burning Force[/b] is a 2.5D shoot 'em up [[science fiction]] arcade [[video game]] that was originally released by [[Namco]] in 1989 only in Japan. It runs on Namco System 2 hardware.

The player controls a 21-year old [[space_marine|space cadet]] named [[Tengenji Hiromi]], who as part of her final training [[battle]]s high-tech [[robot]] enemies on a futuristic combat [[hover bike]].

The game was ported to the [[Sega Mega Drive]] home console in 1990 as well as its [[sega_mega_drive|Sega Genesis]] western version in 1991. It was also re-released in the [i]Arcade Archives[/i] virtual series for modern consoles in 2023.

h4. External links

* "[i]Burning Force[/i] on Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burning_Force
* "Arcade Archives 2023 Official Game Ad":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyAeL1a7POc
* "Main Theme from Namco X Capcom":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utnY2aEthjA

title: tekken_tag_tournament_2
body:
[b]Tekken Tag Tournament 2[/b] (鉄拳タッグトーナメント2) is a fighting game in the Tekken series and the successor to [[1999]]'s [[Tekken Tag Tournament]]. Developed and Published by [[Bandai Namco]], the game was released in Japanese arcades on September 14, 2011, with the console version being released on September 11, [[2012]] for the [[Play Station 3|PS3]] & [[Xbox 360]] and on November 18, 2012 for the [[Wii U]]. 

Unlike the original Tekken Tag Tournament, Tekken Tag Tournament 2 features a storyline although it is still not the series canon. Just like last time, it is more of a "dream match", giving fans the opportunity to play as almost every character in the series up to that point, including some of those that had apparently been missing in the main Tekken storyline, in addition to the character roster of [[Tekken 6]].

In "Fight Lab", Violet is working on a new version of Combot. As soon as Combot is complete, Violet begins its simulation test. After the simulation test, the Combot explodes and destroys the lab. Violet decides to use the other functioning Combot to complete the tests. After Combot completes five tests, Violet kidnaps Jin, Kazuya and Heihachi for Combot's final test. Combot apparently has the upper hand, but Jin transforms into his devil form and destroys it. Violet blows up the Combot, presumably taking the Mishima bloodline with it, and says, "Excellent!"

title: virtual_motion_capture
body:
"Virtual Motion Capture" is software that allows you to control a 3D model of VRM with VR equipment. With this software, you can set high degrees of freedom for hands, expressions, and movements in VR game commentary and video works, as well as use virtual cameras and trackers. Since "Virtual Motion Capture" can freely change the shape of your hands, you can perform movements such as holding something by gripping your hands. In addition, you can also change expressions freely with the controller. Using "Virtual Motion Capture" allows you to shoot videos that make you feel like you're in a VR game, making it ideal for starting VR game commentary.
https://vmc.info/

It's a punk/night club DJ-themed attire consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] [[baseball cap]], a [[black mask|black]] [[mouth mask]], a [[black jacket]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[t-shirt]], a [[chest harness]], a [[black belt|black]] [[leather belt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[half-skirt]] worn over a [[torn skirt|torn]] [[pinstripe skirt|pinstripe]] [[miniskirt]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], [[black socks]] and black shoes.

Her default costume consists of a [[lime hair ornament]], [[hibiscus print]] [[blue hoodie]] with [[detached sleeves]] that [[sleeves past wrists|extend to her hands]] plus a [[zipper]] opening to her left waist, [[short shorts|short]] [[black shorts]], [[yellow belt]], and [[sneakers]]. She is often seen carrying a green [[book]].

title: crowd_surfing
body: Crowd surfing is the process in which a person is passed overhead from person to person (often during a concert), transferring the person from one part of the venue to another. The "crowd surfer" is passed above everyone's heads, with everyone's hands supporting the person's weight. This is most popular at metal, punk, rock, rave and indie concerts.

title: aegis_sword_(xenoblade)
body:
A [[sword]] wielded by [[Pyra (xenoblade)|]], [[Mythra (xenoblade)|]] and [[Pneuma (Xenoblade)|]] in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]. All three incarnations have their own version.

* Pyra's Aegis Sword is uniquely asymmetrical, referencing her status as the weakest aspect of the three. When active, it sprouts a large blade of flame.
* Mythra's Aegis Sword is symmetrical. When active, it opens up and sprouts a large photonic [[energy blade]] from its center, as well as four smaller ones.
* Pneuma's Aegis Sword is also symmetrical. While its color palette is simple, its design is very intricate, and its energy blade is huge compared to even Mythra's version.

The true nature of the Aegis Sword is that [spoiler]it is a Monado, as with [[Malos Monado|its fellow Aegis weapon]][/spoiler].

title: mikeneko_(vtuber)_(old_design)
body:
A design seen on [[Mikeneko (vtuber)|]]'s livestreams and accounts publicly from February to April 2022, prior to her officially debuting her first [[virtual YouTuber]] model. The design follows the general appearance and color scheme of the models she would have as a VTuber, but is more casual in terms of outfit.

She has [[long hair|long]] dull [[pink hair]] with a [[side braid]] on her left tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her costume consisted of a [[black dress]] with a matching black [[neck ribbon]], and a greyish-pink [[sweater|knitted]] [[cardigan]].

Some fans have chosen to continue depicting the design in art as a means of depicting Mikeneko more directly, beyond her VTuber models (without outright drawing art based on her real self).

title: gibson_brands_inc
body:
[i]Gibson Brands Inc[/i], formerly [i]Gibson Guitar Corporation[/i], is a famed maker of [[electric guitar|electric guitars]].  In addition to guitars they also produce other musical instruments and professional audio equipment.

The Epiphone company and brand is owned by Gibson.

h4. Models

* [[Gibson ES-335]]
* [[Gibson explorer]]
* [[Gibson Flying V]]
* [[Gibson Firebird]]
* [[Gibson Hummingbird]]
* [[Gibson Les Paul]]
* [[Gibson RD]]
* [[Gibson SG]]
* [[Gibson Thunderbird]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gibson Brands":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibson_Brands]

title: fender_jaguar
body:
An [[electric guitar]] made by [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]].

The [[Fender Jazzmaster]]'s younger sibling, released by Fender in 1962 as an attempt to win [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] customers over. Despite this, it ashamedly sold poorly during its initial run due to the higher prices compared to two other guitars in the Fender line-up, the [[Fender Stratocaster]] and [[Fender Telecaster]]. It gained traction in the 70's from the punk and post-punk scenes of the time. It's a common sight in shoegaze, indie and alternative rock. [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]'s [[Kurt Cobain]] is most associated with the guitar, owning and using a modded version with DiMarzio humbucking pickups, a modified lower switch plate with a three-way toggle pickup switch and an Adjusto-Matic bridge with a floating tremolo tailpiece.

Key visual differences from the [[Fender Jazzmaster]] include:

* More traditional-looking pickups, the most common configuration being single-coils (post #1125994) and humbuckers (post #3537957, post #2424269).
* A shorter-scale neck.
* A more complex switch circuit system, often situated within chrome plates on the pickguard, the volume and tone knobs along with the cable input are also within a chrome plate (post #1269825).
* A different bridge with a bar attached under the strings on early models.

h4. See also

* [[Fender Stratocaster]]
* [[Fender Telecaster]]
* [[Fender Mustang]]
* [[Fender Jazzmaster]]
* [[Gibson Les Paul]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: gibson_thunderbird
body:
A [[bass guitar]] introduced by [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] in 1963. Despite it's lower popularity due to [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]]'s dominance in the bass market, the Thunderbird gained a strong following due to it's subjectively more aggressive sound, making it a common sight among heavier genres.

It features a recognizably skewed design only shared by its guitar counterpart the Firebird, both designed by Chrysler's Raymond H. Dietrich along with two large pickups often nicknamed "soapbars".

title: fender_musical_instruments_corporation
body:
World-renown American [[instrument]] maker founded by legendary Clarence Leonidas Fender, much better known as [i]Leo Fender[/i] in 1946, situated in Arizona. Fender is mostly known by its line of solid-body [[electric guitar]]s and [[bass guitar]]s which have been passed and played by an endless multitude of both massively popular and underground music players alike.

Some of the better known characters in Japanese media who use Fender instruments, explicitly or not, include [[K-On!]]'s [[Akiyama Mio]] (Jazz Bass) and [[Nakano Azusa]] (Mustang), [[Angel Beats!]]' [[Hisako (Angel Beats!)|Hisako]] (Jazzmaster) and [[Iwasawa Masami]] (Stratocaster), and [[Tokyo 7th Sisters]]' [[Seto Ferb]] (Jazz Bass).

Use this tag when the brand's name/logo is depicted in either the [[commentary]] or the image itself.

h4. Tagged Models
h5. Electric Guitars
* [[Fender Jaguar]]
* [[Fender Mustang]]
* [[Fender Jazzmaster]]
* [[Fender Stratocaster]]
* [[Fender Telecaster]]
h5. Bass Guitars
