title: gibson_les_paul
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] manufactured by [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] since 1952, designed with input by famed jazz guitarist Les Paul whose name ended up as the name of the [[guitar]] itself, work and prototypes commenced in 1950, with 1951 prototypes being strikingly similar to the final product until its introduction in 1952. The Les Paul eventually caught big success in a seemingly endless array of genres, pinning it as one of the most well known and popular guitars along with its contemporaries, the [[Fender Telecaster]] and [[Fender Stratocaster]]. It's similarly been used by musicians far and wide, including [[Slash (Musician)|Slash]], Joe Perry and James Dean Bradfield among others.

The Les Paul also holds a strong cult following in Japan. Within anime and manga, [[K-On!]]'s [[Hirasawa Yui]] is most associated with the Les Paul, using a Cherry Sunburst Les Paul Standard (now Traditional). Other prominent characters include [[iDOLMASTER Million Live!]]'s [[Julia (Idolmaster)|Julia]] using a TV Yellow Les Paul Special, [[Bang Dream!]]'s [[Mitake Ran]] with a red Les Paul copy, and [[Bocchi The Rock!]]'s [[Gotoh Hitori]] with a black Les Paul custom.

Original Les Pauls were released with goldtop finishes, P90 ("soapbar") pickups and either stopbars or tailpieces. Prominent Gibson versions of the Les Paul include:
* Standard, most famous example in anime being Hirasawa Yui's model.
* Junior/Special, lighter glossier model with soapbar pickups with the Junior only sporting a single pickup, most commonly seen being used by iDOLMASTER's Julia.
* DC/DC Lite, a double-cutaway version, famously used in Japan by [[B'z]] guitarist [[Matsumoto Takahiro (B'z)|Matsumoto Takahiro]]. (post #2361213)
* Custom, featuring gold hardware, most commonly seen in either black or white. (post #1867738)

h4. See Also
* [[Gibson SG]]
* [[Gibson ES-335]]
* [[Gibson Flying V]]
* [[Gibson explorer]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Gibson Les Paul":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibson_Les_Paul]

title: gibson_explorer
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] since 1958 as the final iteration of their [i]Futura[/i] prototypes. Made as part of a proposition by Gibson of a line of futuristic designs, the Explorer was part of this trio along with the [[Gibson Flying V]] and the [i]Moderne[/i], the latter seeing release much later. Much like its closest sibling the Flying V, the Explorer was deemed a failure at the start of its production until it was then picked up by hard rock and heavy metal guitarists where it would gain the worldwide popularity it has today. The most notable Explorer players are [[Metallica]]'s [[James Hetfield]] and [[U2 (band)|]]'s The Edge

Its angular design features a pointed headstock and asymmetrical body shape. The Explorer's body is typically made from mahogany or alder wood and features a beveled edge that accentuates its sharp lines. The pointed headstock is adorned with the Gibson logo and six tuning pegs, and the fretboard typically features a set of inlaid dot or block markers. It also features a set of either P90 or PAF humbucking pickups, characteristic of Gibson's guitars.

h4. See also
[[Gibson Les Paul]]
[[Gibson SG]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: gibson_sg
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] made and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] first introduced in 1961, originally as a new, lighter double-cutaway version of the [[Gibson Les Paul]] when its sales had been declining due to the [[Fender Stratocaster]]'s rapid success. However, Lester Polsfuss (Les Paul) hated the new design and demanded that his name not be associated with the guitar. The name change would eventually occur in 1963, being renamed SG which literally stands for [i]Solid Guitar[/i]. The SG eventually became Gibson's best selling model of all time and has been used by famous musicians by the likes of [[AC/DC]]'s [[Angus Young]], [[Frank Zappa]] and [[Radiohead (band)|Radiohead]]'s Thom Yorke.

Among anime and anime-themed characters, [[nitroplus]]'s [[Super Sonico]] and [[Angel Beats!]]'s [[yui_(angel_beats!)|Yui]] are the most prominent.

Common visual traits of the SG include a short and round double-cutaway body, four control knobs, double humbucker setup and a tune-o-matic bridge with stopbar, with certain models (specially earlier) sporting a tailpiece instead.

h4. See Also
* [[Gibson Flying V]]
* [[Gibson Explorer]]
* [[Gibson ES-335]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Gibson SG":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibson_SG]

title: gretsch_6128
body:
Routed solid body [[electric guitar]] named [i]Duo Jet[/i] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[Gretsch]] since 1955. Unveiled in 1953 as a direct competitor to [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]]'s successful [[Gibson Les Paul]], the G6128 features a smaller and slicker design compared to its contemporary brother the [[Gretsch 6120]] along with pickups that give it a more powerful tone while at similarly low frequencies. Compared to the Les Paul, its neck and body are longer and the body in particular is rounder. The name was conceived as a combination of [i]Duo[/i] given the dual-pickup setup and [i]Jet[/i] inspired by advanced aircraft of the day.
[[George Harrison]] is the most well-known player of the G6128, utilising it frequently during [[The Beatles]]' early years, including it in a few of their studio albums.

Key visual traits of the G6128 include a round drop-like pickguard, triangle-arranged control knobs, distinctive V-shape tailpece (most commonly seen with a Bigsby vibrato system) and rocker bridge.

h5. Notable versions
* [b][i]G6128-1962[/i][/b]: A double cutaway version, equipped with Gretsch's in-house "[i]Filtertron[/i]" pickups (Post #731143).
* [b][i]G6128TCG[/i][/b]: A special edition with [[Cadillac]] green ([b][i]CG[/i][/b]) finish and gold hardware.
* [b][i]G6128T 6 12[/i][/b]: Special double-neck version with one of said necks being a twelve-string rather than six.

h4. See also
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: gibson_es-335
body:
Semi-hollow (50% solid-50% hollow) [[electric guitar]], built and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] since 1958 as part of its ES ([i]Electric Spanish[/i]) series. Largely credited to be the world's first commercialized semi-hollow electric guitar, the ES-335 consists of a solid wood block running through the center of the [[guitar]], with the sides being hollow. It went on to become one of the most popular guitars for genres such as Alternative Rock, Jazz, Blues and R&B among similar others with some of its most famous players being the late B.B. King and [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]/Foo Fighters' Dave Grohl.

Visual traits mainly include a round circular double-cutaway body, F-holes, stopbar bridge, four control knobs and the input jack being placed on top of the body.

h4. See also
[[Gibson SG]]
[[Gibson Les Paul]]
[[Gretsch 6120]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: gibson_flying_v
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] since 1958. Built with a futuristic design in mind alongside its closest sibling the [[Gibson explorer|Explorer]], it was initially deemed a failure with less than 100 units being built and sold between 1958 and 1959. The Flying V eventually catched the interest of certain guitarists and slowly gained success until its boom in popularity since the 80's, being popularily used in Metal subgenres for its aggressive looks.

Visually distinguished by the symmetrical V shape with round edges which sonstitue its body and distinguish it from newer V-style models made by the likes of [[Jackson Guitars]].

h4. See also

* [[Gibson SG]]
* [[Jackson King V]]
* [[Jackson Rhoads]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: italia_mondial
body:
Retro-styled solid body [[electric guitar]] manufactured by South Korean [[guitar]] and [[bass guitar]] maker Italia since the late 90's.

It is loosely similar to the [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]]'s [[Gibson Les Paul]]  in design, the biggest differences being:
* Rounder body.
* Pickguard that extends to the control knobs and corners of the guitar.
* Dstinctive number-7 tailpiece.
* 24-fret neck.
* Three tone switches (or knobs) on the pickguard's corner.

The most famous feature in Japanese media is its use by [[Suzumiya Haruhi]] in [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]], inspired by [[Linda Linda Linda]], specifically the co-protagonist Tachibana Kei.

title: vk45.02(p)
body:

There are two versions of this tank - one with the [[turret]] at the front (Vorne) and one with the turret at the back (Hintern), better known as VK 45.02 A and VK 45.02 B respectively as they're named in [[World of Tanks]].

title: agent_3_(splatoon_3)
body:
Protagonist of [i][[splatoon_3|Splatoon3]][/i]'s Hero Mode.

Do not confuse with [i][[agent_3_(splatoon)]][/i].

In this work, the former Agent 3 has succeeded  [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]]  as Captain. Therefore, the new agent inherits the callsign of the previous "Agent 3".

Due to New Agent 3 being the player character, they can be depicted as either gender, though they are often drawn as a girl with [[single_braid|single braid]] [[yellow_hair|yellow]] [[tentacle hair]] thanks to promotional materials surrounding Hero Mode. Regardless, Agent 3 always wears a "hero suit" consisting of a yellow jacket and [[earphones]].
However, the suit is damaged at the beginning of the story, and the story proceeds with a  black [[crop_top|crop top]] top and black [[sweatpants]].
Also, at the beginning of the game and during editing, he wears asymmetrical shirts, sneakers, sunglasses, and cloaks. I often have a [[tri-stringer_(splatoon)|tri-stringer]] in the package and PV.

h4. reference example
* post #4480598 (Beginning part ver.)
* post #5732575 (Hero suit ver.)
* post #5656963 (Torn Hero suit  ver.)

title: fender_telecaster
body:
The Telecaster is a solid-body [[electric guitar]] that was introduced in 1951 by [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]]. It is considered one of the most significant guitar designs in history, having influenced numerous musicians across a variety of genres. The Telecaster's versatility and distinctive sound have made it a popular choice among musicians in various styles of music, including country, rock, blues, and punk.

Features a relatively simple design, with a single-cutaway body made of either ash or alder wood, a bolt-on maple neck, and a rosewood or maple fingerboard. The guitar's unique bridge design allows for precise intonation and sustain. It is equipped with two single-coil pickups, which produce a bright and clear tone that has become a hallmark of the Telecaster sound.

Since its introduction, the Telecaster has undergone numerous changes and variations, including different pickup configurations, finishes, and neck shapes. However, its fundamental design has remained largely unchanged, making it a timeless and enduring symbol of electric guitar innovation and craftsmanship.

h4. See also
h5. Electric Guitars
* [[Fender Jaguar]]
* [[Fender Mustang]]
* [[Fender Jazzmaster]]

title: fender_precision_bass
body:
The Fender Precision Bass, also known as the Fender P Bass, is an electric [[bass guitar]] that was introduced by [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]] in 1951. It is widely regarded as the first commercially successful electric bass guitar and has since become a staple instrument in popular music.

The Precision Bass features a solid body made of ash or alder wood, a bolt-on maple neck, and a rosewood or maple fingerboard. It is equipped with a split single-coil pickup that produces a distinctive, punchy sound with a strong low-end response. The P Bass also features a unique design that allows for easy and precise tuning, making it a popular choice for bass players who demand accuracy and reliability.

Two basic designs exist. The original design (seen on post #1233086) was based on the [[Fender Telecaster]]. In 1957, Fender introduced new, now more common design (seen on post #741032 ) based on the [[Fender Stratocaster]]. The original design was reintroduced in 1968, but was renamed to Telecaster bass. 

Within anime and manga, [[Yamada Ryo]] from [[Bocchi the Rock!]] is associated with the instrument, playing one with a white body, a white pickguard and a rosewood fretboard.

* [[Fender Jazzmaster]]

h5. Bass Guitars

title: fender_mustang
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] created and manufactured by American [[instrument]] maker [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]] in 1964 as a major redesign of their student models, the Musicmaster and Duo-Sonic with the revised versions having the "II" suffix. The Mustang obtained relatively moderate success as a student [[guitar]] until its discontinuation in 1982. Since 1990, in parallel with its reissue, the Mustang has experienced a massive resurgence in popularity, quickly becoming a cult favorite in the 90s Grunge scene due to its low cost and ease of modding. [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]'s [[Kurt Cobain]] is most associated with the guitar, having used a humbucker version.

After its reissue, it also acquired a cult following in Japan, being a frequent guitar used in both J-Pop and J-Rock. In Japanese animation, [[Nakano Azusa]] from [[K-On!]] is the most prominent player, using a Fender Japan '69 Reissue Mustang in Candy Apple Red, nicknamed "Muttan".

Unique visual traits include a round skewed body design, tilted double single-coil pickups on standard models, floating bridge, round pickguard and a chrome control plate.

Visually similar versions of the Mustang include:

* Musicmaster / Musicmaster II
* Duo-Sonic / Duo-Sonic II
* Bronco
* Cyclone
* Jag-Stang

title: fender_stratocaster
body:
Solid body [[electric guitar]], made and produced by American [[instrument]] maker [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]] since 1954.

Designs and prototypes were made around 1953 which were subsequently set into production without minor changes including colors and finishes. Noted and recognised as a revolutionary and innovative guitar at the time, the Stratocaster quickly gained worldwide renown and became one of the most popular electric guitars in history, with its basic design still being used and modified by many other guitar manufacturers to this day. The [[Fender Stratocaster]], alongside the [[Fender Telecaster]], have been used across a wide range of musical genres by countless musicians, with the Strat being associated with legendary guitarists like [[Yngwie Malmsteen]], [[Eric Clapton]], and [[Jimi Hendrix]].

In Japanese animation, [[Iwasawa Masami]] of [[Angel Beats!]] and [[Hanazono Tae]] of [[Bang Dream!]] are two of the most prominent players, the latter using a Stratocaster-style guitar made by [[ESP Guitars]].

Features a unique contour body with double cutaway, triple single-coil setup as standard, three control knobs and tremolo bridge. Akin to the Telecaster, an endless amount of versions and configurations exist, but the base design always stays the same.

title: nishi_takeichi
body:
[b]Lieutenant Colonel Baron Nishi Takeichi[/b] (西 竹一, Nishi Takeichi, July 12, 1902 – c. March 22, 1945) was an [[Imperial Japanese Army]] [[officer]], equestrian show jumper, and Olympic Gold Medalist at the 1932 Los Angeles Olympics. 

During [[World War II]] he was a [[tank]] unit commander at the Battle of [[Iwo Jima]] and was killed in action during the defense of the island.

title: kuribayashi_tadamichi
body:
[b]Kuribayashi Tadamichi[/b] (7 July 1891 – c. 26 March 1945) was a general in the [[Imperial Japanese Army]], part-time writer, haiku poet, diplomat, and commanding officer of the Imperial Japanese Army General Staff. He is best known for having been the commander of the Japanese garrison at the battle of [[Iwo Jima]].

Even before the battle, General Kuribayashi insisted upon sharing the hardships of his men. He also refused to permit banzai charges, which he regarded as an unnecessary waste of his men's lives. The [[United States Marine Corps]] had expected to capture Iwo Jima in five days, but Kuribayashi and his men held out for 36 days. 

It is believed that Kuribayashi was killed in action while leading his soldiers in a night-attack on American troops, but his body was never identified by the United States military.

U.S. Marine Corps "General Holland Smith":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holland_Smith said of Kuribayashi that "Of all our adversaries in the Pacific, Kuribayashi was the most redoubtable...".

h4.See also
* [[Letters From Iwo Jima]]

title: ak-47
body:
The [b]AK-47[/b] ([b]А[/b]втомат [b]К[/b]алашникова образца 19[b]47[/b] года) is a 7.62×39mm [b][[assault rifle]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, developed between 1944–1946 by [[Mikhail Kalashnikov]]. The [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] platform has a reputation for its ruggedness, reliability, simple mechanism and ease of manufacture. It can perform well with poor quality [[ammunition]] and under harsh conditions.

Visual cues of the original AK-47 are its slanted fixed buttstock profile, a milled receiver with a large rectangular indentation as the [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] guide and a smooth dust cover, (see post #4852784).

[b]Do not[/b] simply tag any [[Kalashnikov rifle]]s as AK-47 without even looking at their details.

title: letters_from_iwo_jima
body:
[b]Letters from Iwo Jima[/b] (硫黄島からの手紙, [i]Iōjima Kara no Tegami[/i]) is a 2006 [[Japan]]ese-language [[united_states|American]] war film directed and co-produced by [[Clint Eastwood]], starring "Watanabe Ken":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ken_Watanabe and "Ninomiya Kazunari":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazunari_Ninomiya . 

The film is set in [[World War II]] and is unique and notable because it portrays the Battle of [[Iwo Jima]] from the perspective of the Japanese [[soldier]]s. 

It is a companion piece to Eastwood's "Flags of Our Fathers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flags_of_Our_Fathers_(film) , which depicts the same battle from the American viewpoint; the two films were shot back to back. Letters from Iwo Jima is almost entirely in Japanese, despite being co-produced by American companies DreamWorks Pictures, Malpaso Productions and Amblin Entertainment.

The film was released in Japan on December 9, 2006 and received a limited release in the United States on December 20, 2006 in order to be eligible for consideration for the 79th Academy Awards, for which it received four nominations, including Best Picture and winning Best Sound Editing. It was subsequently released in more areas of the U.S. on January 12, 2007, and was released in most states on January 19. An English-dubbed version of the film premiered on April 7, 2008. Upon release, the film received critical acclaim and although it only grossed slightly better at the box office than its companion, it was much more successful compared to its budget.

h4.Characters
* [[Kuribayashi Tadamichi]] - Played by Watanabe Ken
* [[Nishi Takeichi]] - Played by "Ihara Tsuyoshi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsuyoshi_Ihara
* [[Jupiter (horse)]]

h4.External Links
* "Official International Trailer":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U6rUr0mKwhc

title: iwo_jima
body:
[b]Iwo Jima[/b] (硫黄島, [i]"Sulfur Island"[/i]) is a [[Japan]]ese volcanic island located south of the Bonin islands. Currently adminstated by the [[Tokyo (city)|]] Metropolitan Government. Now officially known as [b]"Ioto"[/b] in Japan.

Best known as the site of "the 1945 Battle of Iwo Jima":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Iwo_Jima during [[World War II]]. The battle ended in a very costly American [[victory]]. It remains the only battle of the Pacific [[war]] where U.S. casualties (26,571) surpassed those of the Empire of Japan (18,375).

title: endou_haruka
body:
Haruka Endou is a secondary character from the [[Girls Und Panzer]] spinoff, [[Girls und Panzer Ribbon no Musha|Girls und Panzer: Ribbon no Musha]]. 

[[Tsuruki Shizuka]], [[Matsukaze Rin]], and Haruka are students at Tatenashi High School. They represent the school in Tankathlon (a cousin of Tankery) under the banner of Team Centipede. Unlike the other two, Haruka is a non-competing member. Instead of serving in the tank crew, her duties appear to be more managerial, financial, and PR-related.  

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[curtained hair]]. More often than not, she wears the [[Tatenashi High School uniform]] along with [[loafers]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

title: nike_air_force_1
body:
A very popular [[basketball]] [[sneakers|sneaker]] produced by [[Nike (company)|]] since 1982. Produced in high-top, mid-top, and low-top varieties, and in a wide variety of color schemes, including collaborations with other brands and designers. 

The most recognizable version of the shoe is the all-white low-top model, often considered a staple piece of [[streetwear]] fashion. The high-top and mid-top models can be distinguished from other Nike sneakers by the velcro strap around the ankle.

title: nike_mag
body:
A fictional [[sneakers|sneaker]] model of the future designed by [[Nike (company)|]] for [[Back to the Future|Back to the Future 2]], in which they were worn by [[Marty McFly]]. The shoes had a distinctive very high top, and were notable for their self-lacing feature. 

In 2011 Nike released a real life version of the sneaker with the same self-tightening feature from the movie in a limited run of 89 pairs. These have gone on to become some of the most expensive sneakers of all time, with pairs selling for upwards of $75000 USD.

title: xamel
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

[b]YMS-16M Xamel[/b]

One of the biggest land-based [[mobile suit]]s ever developed by [[Zeon]] during the UC, almost slipping into [[Mobile Armor]] territory, the prototype Xamel was a huge artillery type MS, carrying an 8-stack rocket launcher, a 20mm seven-barreled Gatling cannon and a gargantuan 680mm super-heavy artillery gun which could destroy almost anything in a single shot. 

Despite its immense size and girth, the suit was somehow very fast courtesy of its ultra-high output hover thrusters, arranged similarly to the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]].

body: Lü Bu Fengxian is Humanity's representative in the first round of Ragnarok, going against Thor. Lü Bu is also the main character of his spin-off manga, "The Legend of Lü Bu".

title: jack_the_ripper_(shuumatsu_no_valkyrie)
body: Jack the Ripper is humanity's representative in the fourth round of Ragnarok, going up against [[heracles (shuumatsu no valkyrie)|Heracles]]. Jack is also the main character of his spin-off manga, "Jack the Ripper's Case Files".
other_names: ジャック・ザ・リッパー

body: Hermes is the 10th of the 12 Gods of Olympus. He is a Messenger of the Gods.

title: h.r._giger
body:
Deceased Swiss artist (February 5, 1940 - May 12, 2014)

[b]Hans Rudolf "H.R." Giger[/b] was a painter and set designer, most famous for his work in the [[alien (1979)|Alien]] movie. He created the [[Xenomorph]] and the [[Space Jockey]].

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._R._Giger]

title: prometheus_(movie)
body:
[b]Prometheus[/b] is a 2012 [[science fiction]] horror film directed by Ridley Scott and written by Jon Spaihts and Damon Lindelof. The film stars [[Noomi Rapace]], [[Michael Fassbender]], Guy Pearce, Idris Elba, Logan Marshall-Green and Charlize Theron. 

Set in the late 21st century, the story centers on the crew of the [[spacecraft]] Prometheus as they follow a star map discovered among the remnants of several ancient Earth civilizations. Led to a distant world and an advanced extraterrestrial civilization, the crew seeks the origins of humanity, but instead discovers a threat that could cause the extinction of the human race.

The film began development in the early 2000s as a fifth entry in the Alien franchise, with both Scott and director [[James Cameron]] developing ideas for a film that would serve as a prequel to Scott's 1979 science fiction horror film [[alien (1979)|Alien]]. James Cameron eventually left the project to focus in his sci-fi film [[avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]].

By late 2010, Ridley Scott brought Lindelof onto the project to rewrite Spaihts' script, and together they developed a separate story that precedes the story of Alien but is not directly connected to that franchise. According to Scott, though the film shares "strands of Alien's DNA, so to speak", and takes place in the same universe, Prometheus explores its own mythology and ideas.

Prometheus was released on June 1, 2012, in the United Kingdom and parts of Europe and June 8, 2012 in the United States and Canada. It was released on August 24, 2012 in Japan.

h4. Characters
* [[Elizabeth Shaw]]
* [[David 8]]
* [[Meredith Vickers]]
* [[Fifield]]
* [[Milburn]]

h4. Monsters
* [[Hammerpede]]
* [[trilobite_(prometheus)|Trilobite]]
* [[Proto-Xenomorph]]

title: neomorph

title: weyland-yutani
body:
[i]"BUILDING BETTER WORLDS..."[/i] - Company Tagline

[b]Weylan-Yutani[/b] is a fictional company from [[Alien (1979)|]], [[Aliens (1986)|]] and other [[science fiction]] horror movies set in the same universe. 

It is also referenced in the [[Alien vs. Predator]] series and the [[Prometheus (movie)|]] film.

title: derelict
body:
An [[alien]] [[derelict]] [[spacecraft]] first featured in the [[science fiction]] horror movie [[alien (1979)|Alien]].

It was designed by Swiss surrealist artist [[h.r._giger|Hans Rudolf "Ruedi" Giger]] in the 70s.

h4. See also

* [[Space Jockey]]
* [[engineer_(prometheus)|Engineer]]

title: protomorph
body:
A fictional [[alien]] monster from the [[alien (1979)|Alien series]]. It first appeared in the [[Alien: Covenant]] film from 2017.

It is an early weaker form of the original [[Xenomorph]]. [spoilers]It was created by [[David 8]] using different alien creatures and Dr. [[Elizabeth Shaw]]'s mutated [[DNA]].[/spoilers]

title: alien_queen
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[monster]] from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] and [[Alien vs. Predator]] franchises.

Is a new stage of the life cycle of the original [[Xenomorph]] creature from the first [[alien (1979)|Alien film]] that was created by H.R. Giger in the 70s.

[b]Alien Queens[/b] are a bigger, more aggressive and intelligent form of Xenomorph that can produce eggs from where other Xenomorphs can spawn. 

It was designed in the 80s by director [[James Cameron]] and the late special effects creator Stan Winston based on the original Alien design.

title: nested_mouths
body:
A mouth that contains a smaller mouth or set of jaws inside it. Can be used for multiple "layers" of mouths inside mouths (such as an [[eldritch abomination]] might have, but does not apply to masks with mouth or jaw designs.

Commonly found in the [[xenomorph|eponymous aliens]] and [[Alien Queen]] of the [[alien (1979)|Alien franchise]].

title: uscss_nostromo
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [i]Alien[/i] [[science fiction]] and horror movie franchise. 

It first appeared in the original [[alien (1979)|Alien]] film from 1979.

[[Ellen Ripley]] is part of the Nostromo crew.

title: pokemon_gsc_(prototype)
body:
Unreleased content from [i][[pokemon_gsc|Pokémon GSC]][/i]. See [[list_of_pokemon_media|list of Pokémon media]] for more prototype games.

Notably, a prototype version of the Japanese [i]Gold and Silver[/i] was shown at the event Space World 1997, held on November 21-23, 1997 in Japan. The ROM was eventually leaked online on May 31, 2018. It contains many Pokémon that were significantly redesigned or scrapped in the final version.

title: aliens_(1986)
body:
[i]THIS TIME IT'S WAR...!!![/i] - Main tagline.

[b]Aliens[/b] is a 1986 [[science fiction]] horror and action film directed by [[James Cameron]] and starring Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn, Lance Henriksen, William Hope, and Bill Paxton. 

A sequel to the 1979 film [[alien (1979)|Alien]], Aliens follows Weaver's character [[Ellen Ripley]] as she returns to the planet where her crew first encountered the hostile [[xenomorph|Alien]] monster, this time accompanied by a platoon of [[Colonial Marine]]s.

Aliens grossed $86 million at the domestic box office during its 1986 theatrical release and $131 million internationally. 

The movie was nominated for seven Academy Awards, including a Best Actress nomination for Sigourney Weaver, the first nomination ever made for an actor or actress in a science fiction film. 

It won in the categories of Sound Effects Editing and Visual Effects. It won eight Saturn Awards, including Best Science Fiction Film, Best Actress for Weaver and Best Direction for Cameron.

This film has influenced several works of fiction and subsequent [[video game]]s and films across the following decades.

h4. See also

* [[newt_(aliens)|Newt]]
* [[M41A Pulse Rifle]]
* [[M56 Smartgun]]
* [[Power Loader]]
* [[apc_(aliens)|APC]]
* [[Weyland-Yutani]]
* [[Alien Queen]]

title: newt_(aliens)
body: A fictional female character from the [[science fiction]] action/horror movie [[Aliens (1986)|]], released in the 80s.

title: m41a_pulse_rifle
body:
A fictional futuristic [[weapon]] that first appeared in the [[Aliens (1986)|]] action and horror [[science fiction]] film from the 80s.

The [b]ARMAT M41A Pulse Rifle[/b] is the standard issue combat rifle of the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

It is made of advanced lightweight and highly resistant alloys and is also equipped with a digital ammo counter and a progressive trigger. Given its small size, high rate of fire, accuracy and caliber is used both as an [[assault rifle]] and a [[submachine gun]]. The M41 uses 99 round caseless ammunition magazines and fires a 10 mm armor piercing projectile. 

It is an advanced firearm that is best used in short controlled bursts given its rapidly depleting ammunition due to a very high rate of fire.

Each Pulse Rifle also possess an underslung 30 mm integrated grenade launcher with a 4 round capacity. It is able to fire standard explosive, HE and incendiary grenade rounds.

In [[real life]] the M41 prop was designed by "Stan Winston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston and [[James Cameron]] in the mid eighties using parts from a [[Thompson submachine gun]] and a [[SPAS-12]].

h4. See also

* [[assault rifle]]
* [[grenade launcher]]
* [[Colonial Marine]]

h4. External links

* AVP Wiki: "M41A":[https://www.avpcentral.com/pulse-rifle-variants]

title: syd_mead
body:
[quote][i]I'VE CALLED [[SCIENCE FICTION]] "REALITY AHEAD OF SCHEDULE"....[/i] - [b]Syd Mead[/b][/quote]

An [[united_states|American]] visual concept artist born in 1933. After graduating from Art School Syd worked for many advertising agencies and as a car designer and concept artist for car companies in the 50s. Later he was hired by [[NASA]] in the 60s to make [[realistic]] depictions and pre-visualization work on several [[real life]] [[spacecraft]] projects (which would help him greatly to develop techniques he would later apply to his very sober, sound, detailed and realistic looking science fiction works).   

Syd Mead would become best known for his designs for 80s film productions such as [[Blade Runner]] (the [[Spinner]]), [[Aliens (1986)|]] (the [[Sulaco]] [[spacecraft]]), [[Tron]] (the lightcycles, digital tanks, solar sailer, and Sark's carrier designs) and [[2010 (book)|]] (the Leonov spaceship), all of which gave him notoriety in the field. In the 90s he also worked on the designs for the [[Turn A Gundam]] [[mecha]] anime series and the aborted [[Yamato2520]] (a sequel to [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]]).

On December 30, 2019, Syd died in his Pasadena home at the age of 86, after three years of fighting lymphoma.

h4. See also

* [[Syd Mead (designer)]]

* [[Syd Mead (style)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Syd Mead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syd_Mead]

title: jenette_vasquez
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] [[science fiction]] and horror film from the 80s.

[b]Jenette Vasquez[/b] is a very capable [[space marine]] from the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

Her weapon of choice is the [[M56 Smartgun]].

She was played by actress Jenette Goldstein, who ironically, is not Hispanic in real life but a fair-skinned Jewish-American woman.

[b]Corporal Dwayne Hicks[/b] is a very capable [[space marine]] from the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

His weapon of choice is the [[M41A Pulse Rifle]].

title: bill_rizer
body:
A main character and hero from the [[Contra]] [[video game]] series.

[b]Bill Rizer[/b] was modeled after the look of actor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] in the movie [[commando_(movie)|Commando]].

His name is a tribute to actors [b]Bill[/b] Paxton and Paul [b]Reiser[/b], who appeared in the movie [[Aliens (1986)|]].

[[Lance Bean]] is Bill's best friend and brother in arms.

body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]]  from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] [[science fiction]] and horror film from the 80s.

The [b]USCMS Sulaco[/b] is a combat starcruiser of the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

In [[real life]] the ship was designed by  [[Syd Mead]] in the mid eighties.

title: james_cameron
body:
[b]James Francis Cameron[/b] (born on August 16, 1954) is a Canadian director of two of the highest grossing films of all time.

He is also famous for many [[science fiction]] films he has directed during his career. In March 7, 2012, Cameron became the third person to reach "Challenger Deep":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Challenger_Deep], the Earth's deepest point.

title: contra
body:
[b][i]Contra[/i][/b] (魂斗羅 [i]Kon-to-ra[/i]) is a classic [[video game]] series produced by [[Konami]] composed primarily of run and gun-style shoot-'em-ups. 

The series debuted in 1987 as a coin-operated [[arcade]] game simply titled "Contra", which was followed by the release of "Super Contra" in 1988 and several sequels produced for various home platforms.

The plot of the games is set in the future, when the Earth faces multiple invasions by [[alien]] forces that try to conquer our planet. The original Contra videogames were influenced by many [[Science fiction]] and action films from the 80s, most notably [[commando_(movie)|Commando]], the [[Rambo]] movies and [[Aliens (1986)|]].

The in-universe use of the term "Contra" is first explained within the Japanese instruction card of the arcade version of Contra, and reiterated in most games (including Contra: Shattered Soldier), as "a title awarded to a superior soldier possessing almost super human drive and ability, while excelling in guerrilla tactics".

The arcade version of Contra was released in February 20, 1987, a few months after the Iran-Contra affair was made public. While it is unclear whether the game was deliberately named after the Nicaraguan Contra rebels (since the company that made the game is Japanese and not American), the ending theme of the original game was titled "Sandinista" (サンディニスタ?), after the adversaries of the real-life Contras.

A home version was released for the [[NES]] home console in 1988, along with ports for various computer formats, including the MSX2. The home versions were localized in the PAL region as [b][i]Gryzor[/i][/b] on the various computer formats and as [[Probotector]] on the European NES, released long later. Several Contra sequels were produced following the original game.

h4.List of games

title: lance_bean
body:
A main character and hero from the [[Contra]] videogame series.

[b]Lance Bean[/b] was modeled after the look of actor [[Sylvester Stallone]] in the [[Rambo]] movie series.

His name is a tribute to actors [b]Lance[/b] Henriksen and Michael [b]Biehn[/b], who appeared in the movie [[Aliens (1986)|]].

[[Bill Rizer]] is Lance's best friend and brother in arms.

title: m56_smartgun
body:
A fictional futuristic weapon that first appeared in the [[Aliens (1986)|]] science fiction and horror film from the 80s.

The [b]M56 Smartgun[/b] is a self-targeting heavy [[machine gun]] attached to a harness that is used as a squad support weapon by the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps. 

An optical sensor in the gun detects moving targets previously programmed as such in a computer stored in the chest armor of the operator. Then when the target is in front of the weapon the suspension arm self adjusts to lock on the objective. 

The smartgun is a very effective weapon for attacking upcoming hordes of fast enemies of any kind.

The user receives visual data from a [[headset]] connected to the targeting computer. It is equipped with a HUD display that shows the targeted treats and an alarm that informs the operator when a target is acquired. 

It has two modes of operation: tracking and non-tracking fire. The smartgun uses caseless, high penetration armor piercing and explosive rounds. It's a formidable weapon that has two main disadvantages: Its size and heavy weight which reduce mobility and its rapidly depleting ammunition when not used properly.

In [[real life]] the M56 was designed by "Stan Winston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston and [[James Cameron]] in the mid eighties, by using components from a steady cam harness, a [[WWII]] era German [[mg42]] [[machine gun]] and several [[motorcycle]] parts.

title: m314_motion_tracker
body:
A fictional futuristic [[military]] device that first appeared in the [[Aliens (1986)|]] action and horror [[science fiction]] film from the 80s.

The [b]M314 Motion Tracker[/b] is an advanced motion detector used as a personal 2D combat radar by the members of the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

title: power_loader
body:
A fictional powered [[exoskeleton]] [[mecha]] first featured in the [[Aliens (1986)|]] science fiction horror film from the 80s.

The [b]Power Loader[/b] is used to load heavy weights in  [[spacecraft]]s and [[hangar bay]]s. The [[Colonial Marine]]s use it to load weaponry in their spaceship hangars.

It was designed by "Stan Winston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston and [[James Cameron]] in the mid eighties.

title: colonial_marine
body:
A member of a fictional futuristic [[military]] organization from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] and [[Alien vs. Predator]] science fiction horror and action franchises.

The [b]United States Colonial Marine Corps[/b], or United States Colonial Marines, are a high-tech army of [[space marine]]s tasked with the protection of human off-world colonies and the security of other planetary settlements.

They are highly trained and equipped with advanced weaponry, tactical nukes and specialized vehicles such as space cruisers, transport [[spacecraft]], [[tank]]s, armored personnel carriers, [[starfighter]]s, dropships and shuttles.

Most of their operations involve small squads supported by heavy ordinance, a capital ship used as both an assembly area transport and command base as well as high tech attack vehicles.

h4. See also

title: apc_(aliens)
body:
A fictional heavy armed and armored military transport vehicle from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] science fiction horror film from the 80s.

The [b]USCMC M577 Armoured Personnel Carrier[/b] or [b]APC[/b] is a vehicle used by the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps as a heavy armored and armed troop transport as well as a hostile reconnaissance vehicle.

title: bifurcated_jaw
body: A jaw that opens both vertically and horizontally, a design sometimes used for monstrous [[alien]]s and creatures. Examples include [[Predator (character)|]] and [[Sangheili]].

title: noguchi_machiko
body:
A fictional female main character from the AVP [[science fiction]] series.

[b]Noguchi Machiko[/b] (野口真千子), known as Da'dtou-di ("Small Knife") by the [[Predator (character)|]]s, is the original main protagonist of the first [[Alien vs. Predator]] comic series from the early 90s.

An [[Asian]] female from the far future, Machiko is a very intelligent, cultured and strong willed [[Japan]]ese woman in top physical condition for her sex and age. Despite her small size and very calm and gentle demeanor, she is actually an expert in the use of self-defense [[martial arts]] techniques and many types of firearms. She is quite deadly and relentless when the situation arises.

Machiko is a Chigusa Corporation employee and the administrator in charge of the Prosperity Wells space colony on planet Ryushi.

title: amagami
body:
A dating sim game for the [[playstation_2|PS2]] by [i]Enterbrain[/i], adapted into six manga anthologies and an anime series as [i]Amagami SS[/i], with an experimental omnibus in which each girl gets her story arc. In 2022, a series of ASMR videos performed by each of the main heroines was released by Mimicle.

After being unceremoniously rejected two Christmas Eves ago, [[Tachibana Jun'ichi]] has since become reluctant to fall in love again. All that changes, however, when he reaches his second-year and encounters six girls who may give him a chance to love once again - [[morishima_haruka|a school idol]], [[tanamachi_kaoru|his tomboyish friend]], [[nakata_sae|a friend]] of his younger sister [[tachibana_miya|Miya]], [[nanasaki_ai|an ace swimmer]], [[sakurai_rihoko|his childhood friend]], and [[ayatsuji_tsukasa|his class's Representative]].

Currently it's Japanese only, though a team on 4chan has been working on a PC rip and translation for some time now.

h6. Main characters

* [[Tachibana Jun'ichi]]

title: l85
body:
L85, or "Land Service, 1985", is a standard [[assault_rifle|assault rifle]] of the British Armed Forces. Originally named SA80 (standing in for "Small Arms for the 1980s"), it is a [[bullpup|bullpup-style]] assault rifle evolved from an earlier British EM-2 prototype designed to test the viability of intermediate cartridges as well as taking design cues from Armalite's AR-18 rifle. The L85A2 variant remains in service today, as well as other variants such as the shorter-barreled L22A2 and L86 LSW, its light [[machine_gun|machine gun]] variant.

The SA80 family was the last weapon to be manufactured by Royal Small Arms Factory in Enfield before its closure. Thus, a significant portion of the guns produced were highly unreliable and flawed in many places. The rifle then had its production switched to other factories, until eventually being upgraded by Heckler and Koch, producing the A2 variant in the year 2000. While its quality did finally improve, the damage was already done; it is considered to be a very unreliable rifle by just about everyone, especially the soldiers that used it in the 1991 Gulf War.

Easily distinguished by its stocky, spartan appearance and oftentimes tan-colored heat shield in front of the gun. Newer models may have Picatinny rails attached in front instead.

title: train_passenger_(yume_nikki)
body:
A group of three characters located [[train_interior|in a train]], who are similar in look to the [[wheelie_(yume_nikki)|Wheelies]].

If [[Madotsuki]] first enters the train from the [[forest|Dense Woods]], a passenger will be sitting on the left seat. 
* This passenger has [[red eyes]], a black body, and orange arms. 

If [[Madotsuki]] enters the traincar from the [[Witch]]'s Island, there will be two passengers sitting on the right seats.
* One of them has two eyes and a maroon body, and the other one has a [[one-eyed|single eye]] and a purple body. Both of them have [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]].

"Yume Nikki Wiki":[https://yumenikki.fandom.com/wiki/Train_Passengers]

She spawns somewhat close to an [[igloo]], northwest of [[Snow]] World's [[door]].

body:
A character found through a [[painting_(object)|painting]] in the [[Art Gallery]], or through an area of the Red [[Brick]] [[Maze]] that you are sent to by interacting with one of the [[shadow_lady_(yume_2kki)|Shadow Ladies]] in the [[Day]] and [[Night]] [[tower|Towers]].

He has [[blonde hair]] and wears a [[multicolored shirt]], a black [[dog]]-like [[mask]] and [[jeans]]. He is sometimes seen wearing a [[beret]] while [[painting_(action)|painting]].

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Kamen_Eshi_(Masked_Painter)]

title: odorika
body:
An oriental-styled [[cyclops]] [[dancer]] located in Red [[lamppost|Streetlight]] World, in the center of a large [[circle]] of [[lamppost|streetlights]]. 

She is shown wearing a red [[china dress]], with [[bandages_over_eyes|bandages covering where her eyes]] should be and a large [[third eye]] in the middle of her [[forehead]].

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Odorika]

title: megusuri_uri
body:
An eye [[doctor]] with [[extra_eyes|four eyes]] covering his face, and two eyes on the back side of his head.

His [[dark]] appearance is similar to that of [[midori_tokuro_(yume_2kki)|Midori Tokuro]].

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Odorika]

title: kanban_otoko
body:
A man with a sign for a head, standing between [[sewer|Sewers]] and [[Japan]] Town. 

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Kanban_Otoko_(Sign_Man)]

title: kenpei-san
body:
The assistant of [[the_commando_(yume_2kki)|the Commando]]. When on the [[submarine]], they will make the outer shell [[invisible]] so you may see if you are on the [[underwater|bottom of the sea]] or not. 

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#The_Commando_and_Provost-san_(Kenpei-san)]

title: masukuredi
body:
The owner of the [[Mask]] Shop, who wears a [[mask_on_head|mask on the side of her head]]. 

She is either [[sleeping|napping]] or doing something behind her [[desk]]. She comes up to serve you when interacted with.

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Mask_Shop_Owner]

title: midori_tokuro_(yume_2kki)
body:
A [[one-eyed]] lady wearing a [[black dress]] with [[green gloves|green]] [[elbow gloves]]. She appears in each area of the Dressing Room.

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Midori_Tokuro]

title: art_gallery
body:
An [[art gallery]] is a room or a [[building]] in which visual art is displayed.

h4. See also:
* [[museum]]
* [[painting (object)]]

title: maze
body:
A [[maze]] is a path or collection of paths, typically from an entrance to a goal. 

The word is used to refer both to branching tour puzzles through which the solver must find a route, and to simpler non-branching ("unicursal") patterns that lead unambiguously through a convoluted layout to a goal.

title: shadow_lady_(yume_2kki)
body:
[[shadow_lady_(yume_2kki)|Shadow Ladies]] are the main chasers in [[Yume 2kki]], and are equivalent to the [[Toriningen]] from [[Yume Nikki]]. 

They are found in many places in the [[dreaming|dream]] world and will trap you in a small area or [[maze]] you can't escape from.

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Chasers#Shadow_Ladies.2FBlack_Witches]

title: bane_jack
body:
[[Bane Jack]] is a [[clown]] that lives in the Apartments. He has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]], wearing a [[black headwear|black]] [[hat]].

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Bane_Jack]

title: surimuki
body:
[[Surimuki]] (lit. Scraped Girl) is an obscure character only known through finding a [[book]] in the [[Library]]. 

Enter the library, go left to the last book in the first [[bookshelf|bookcase]]. You will be greeted by lined [[paper]]. Press enter and words will appear, she will pop up and [[laughing|giggle]]/[[crying|sob]]. This note she has written says "すりむいちゃった。" meaning, "I got [[injury|scraped]]."

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Surimuki]

title: ruan_mei_(lambda's_friend)_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A version of [[Ruan Mei (honkai: star rail)|]] first introduced in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]'s [[Critter Pick (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] event.

Has the appearance of a small black-and-white [[siamese cat|siamese]] [[cat]]-like critter with [[blue eyes]], encased in a blue cake.

title: yukata_(yume_2kki)
body:
A [[fox mask|fox-masked]] man in a colorful [[yukata]] that can be found in The Invisible Maze and The Baddies Bar.

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Minor_Characters#Yukata]

title: aojiru_(yume_2kki)
body:
[[aojiru_(yume_2kki)|Aojiru/Aoshiru]] (lit. "green juice") is a patient in the [[Hospital]], shown with [[bandaged_head|bandages around their head]], wearing a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[shirt]], and hooked up to an [[intravenous_drip|IV]]. 

The green substance being fed through the [[intravenous_drip|IV]] seems to be the same one that oozes from the bed in the event that takes you to their room.

"2kki Wiki":[https://yume2kki.fandom.com/wiki/Aojiru]

title: neue_ziel
body:
[b]AMX-002 (AMA-X2) Neue Ziel[/b]
A monstrous [[mobile armor]] created in secret by Zeon remnants, with possible help from [[Haman Karn]] and Axis. Guarded by a tough I-Field, loaded with mega particle cannons pointing everywhere and capable of performing all-range attacks with its wired claw arms similarly to the [[Zeong]] by using a quasi-psycommu system, it was a ferocious beast in combat - and to top it off, it had the best Zeon had as its pilot - the Nightmare of Solomon, [[Anavel Gato]].

title: nasuhara_anastasia
body: [[Onii-chan Dakedo Ai sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne|OniAi]] character. She has [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She usually maintains a [[expressionless|stoic expression]], but will sometimes make suggestive remarks and flirt with [[himenokouji_akito|Akito]].

title: kaguya_hime
body: A character from the Japanese folktale [[Taketori Monogatari]] (The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter). [[Houraisan Kaguya]] is based on her.

title: drhachiman
body: Commissioner

title: whitebeard_pirates_jolly_roger
body: The Jolly Roger for the [[Whitebeard Pirates]], a large and powerful pirate crew in [[One Piece]] led by [[Edward Newgate]]. It consists of a purple [[skull and crossbones]], with a grinning skull donning Newgate's large white [[mustache]], and bones oriented horizontally and vertically instead of diagonally.

title: super_baby
body: Web josei manga by Meme Maguro. It can be legally read "here":[https://comic-trail.com/episode/13933686331767004586]

title: leo_(mobile_suit)
body:
OZ-06MS Leo (リーオー, Riioo)

A mass-produced [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam]] series. 
The [[mecha]] was appeared in Mobile Suit [[Gundam Wing]] (= After Colony timeline).

The Leo series are characterized by their [[CRT]]-like faces and gained infamy for their very weak defenses (even more than the notorious [[GM (mobile suit)|]] series), where even a beam weapon such as a [[buster rifle]] missed in hitting them is more than enough for them to be destroyed instantly. It is also joked that if a Leo is piloted by a named character, its specs and survivability rate greatly increases.

title: gesuko_(tnk_triplea)
body: [[Original]] character by [[tnk triplea]].
